GuardsAvenge.text: Why not? That's what her kind did to Kanon.

Friend.speaker: Memnos
Friend.text: So much death. So much waste.
Friend.context: NodeContext: Arka is dead. Cold grief - not falling apart, but trying to keep it together.

PAD_Shot.speaker: Player
PAD_Shot.text: Sloppily done. But I guess the goblin had it coming.

PAD_Shot.speaker: Player
PAD_Shot.text: Won't shed tears over a goblin, but still - not a pretty scene.

session_synopses.AD_Guards: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.
session_synopses.Transit: The grieving tiefling pair moves to Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.
session_synopses.GuardsAvenge: The grieving tiefling pair at the gate face off with Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.
session_synopses.Friend: Memnos - the supporting optional tiefling character in the Captive Goblin situation, Friend to Arka.
session_synopses.PAD_Shot: Arka has just killed Sazza with her crossbow. Reaction of the party.Requires 2 characters.Speaker 1 is the character who let Arka do the deed through the dialog, as such their reply should keep that in mind.Speaker 2 is a nearby companion who instigates the PAD and can have an opinionated line.

PAD_FirstInsight.speaker: Player
PAD_FirstInsight.text: I'd swear that ox's gaze is following me.

session_synopses.PAD_FirstInsight: The player walks past and, if they notice (pass an insight check), responds to the ox looking at them strangely.
session_synopses.AD_ToronCurious: Toron notices you speaking with the strabge ox, but he's not too concerned, just curious.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Wyvern poison. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better a quick draught than ceremorphosis, nonetheless.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better to have on hand than not.

AD_Busy.speaker: Nettie
AD_Busy.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand raised in a sign to wait and then turns back to what she was doing .NodeContext: Terse, impatient. She's dealing with serious matters right now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: First you save us from goblins, then you bring Kagha back from the brink. You're making your mark.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.NodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Give me a moment. I'll be right with you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the playerNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Excuse me? I'm more important than some bird.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: God or fieldmouse, no one's more important than the patient in front of you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still working on the birdNodeContext: Working on bird, doesn't look up at player

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Vis medicatrix...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casts spell (healing word) on the bird.NodeContext: A quietly murmured spell

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: There. It's up to her now. Life or death.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at the birdNodeContext: Still looking at the bird

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what -
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Friendly, but cuts herself off when she sees you're a race she doesn't like

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Drow. Last time I saw one of you folk, he tried to slit me open. I hope you're more agreeable.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like drow, but she's willing to give you a chance.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where did you see another drow?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: That's neither here nor there.
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Look, you obviously want something. What is it?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what was it you needed?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Turns to player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Are you good enough to treat people, or just pets?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Good enough to tell there's nothing obviously wrong with you.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: A bit tired, maybe. But we're all a bit tired.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: You seem healthy enough. A bit tired 'round the eyes, maybe.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.NodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No good way of putting this. I... uh... have a tadpole in my head.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: A tadpole? A mind flayer tadpole?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Suddenly grave, giving you her full attention. A mind flayer is an incredibly dangerous creature.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Actually, never mind. I'll get help elsewhere.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: No! If you're right...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent 'No!' you can't just let them walk out of here. It's a dangerous situation.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Come, follow me. I might be able to help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: In command, but grave. She's decided she has to kill the player.

AD.speaker: Nettie
AD.text: Halsin would have known what to do. Damn it all.

Bird.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird.text: To find Halsin. There's not a moment to lose!

AD_TadpoledStart.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledStart.text: We need to be quick. This way.
AD_TadpoledStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing for the player to follower her as she escorts them to the storage room, where they will be quarantined. NodeContext: Concerned

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I wonder what happened to that drow.

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: Is there a dead tadpole in that jar?

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I can't tell if this is a temple or a library.

AD_TadpoledCombat.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat.text: I don't want to hurt you - but I have to protect the others.

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.text: They did a number on you, didn't they?
AD_WithBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Sadly

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Gently, as if to a child

PAD_Dying.speaker: Player
PAD_Dying.text: Argh, the poison. It's too much. It's too late...
PAD_Dying.context: NodeContext: You're dying, poison has overtaken your system. These are your last words.

HealedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
HealedBird.text: There was so much noise out there. I'm glad you're okay.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: Looks like Halsin's our best bet for a cure.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: We need to find him, before it's too late.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: What if something happened to him?

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: All the more reason to hurry.

session_synopses.PAD_Cyanide: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.
session_synopses.AD_Busy: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.
session_synopses: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."
session_synopses.AD: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.
session_synopses.Bird: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledStart: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeDrow: The player broke inside the room without Nettie. Normally they follow her inside and they get the info from her. The VB stops playing when the tadpoled scene with Nettie starts or when Halsin is found in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledCombat: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene
session_synopses.AD_WithBird: Nettie is tending to a badly wounded bird. The bird is weak, its life hangs in the balance, but Nettie is doing what she can.
session_synopses.PAD_Dying: The player has the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN on them. This status has 3 stages leading to death. This PAD plays after a long rest: the player let the status get worse and worse. Right after this PAD, the player dies. These are their last words.
session_synopses.HealedBird: The 'Wounded Bird' that Nettie was treating after some time has passed (after Goblin Hunt or Attack on Den). The bird's recovering and feels a bit better.
session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleResearch: Player read Halsin's research on the mind flayer tadpole. The VB plays only if they didn't find Halsin already and didn't go through the tadpoled scene with Nettie (otherwise they got all that information from her so it's not a surprise).

AD_Adventurer2AtGate.speaker: Remira
AD_Adventurer2AtGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking up at Zevlor. NodeContext: Terrified. Thinks she's about to die.

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate.text: That pack of goblins will be on us any second!

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Zevlor
PleaAtTheGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: to KanonNodeContext: to Kanon

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate.text: Goblins are on our tail. Open the gate, Zevlor. Now.

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Zevlor
PleaAtTheGate.text: You led goblins here? Where is the druid?

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A4 - Aradin : Arguing upward with Zevlor / picking up arrow from Barth sheild and showing it to Zevlor as a proof
 Barth : Alert of the danger / Get distracted by Aradin
NodeContext: Desperate

PleaAtTheGate.text:
CinematicNodeContext: A5 - Zevlor: Looking at Aradin / His attention is cought in the horison
Aradin: Looking at Zevlor / Turn around, his attention is cought in the horison
Barth : Alerted and scanning around
Remira : Alerted and scanning around
Worg : Voice is OFFscreen

Aradin: Looking at Zevlor / Turn around, his attention is cought in the horison
Barth : Alerted and scanning around
Remira : Alerted and scanning around

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Zevlor
PleaAtTheGate.text: By the Nine Hells. Open the gate!
PleaAtTheGate.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A6 - Worg : Slowly stop on a perfect menacing position
Zevlor : Not in shot

PleaAtTheGate.text:
CinematicNodeContext: A8 - Kanon : Run toward the Wheel / Start turning it
Arka : Goes to a nearby stand to pick-up weapon / Look at Kanon
NodeContext: Both Alerte-ready for duties, worried
PleaAtTheGate.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A8 - Kanon : Run toward the Wheel / Start turning it
Arka : Goes to a nearby stand to pick-up weapon / Look at Kanon
NodeContext: Both Alerte-ready for duties, worried

PleaAtTheGate.text: CinematicNodeContext: A9 - Bow are armed and arrow are shot. The Goblin are hiding in the bushes, this is an ambush. ( mocap one multiple time  (3 is good))
PleaAtTheGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: A9 - Bow are armed and arrow are shot. The Goblin are hiding in the bushes, this is an ambush. ( mocap one multiple time  (3 is good))

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Zevlor
PleaAtTheGate.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A10 - Kanaon : Wile he turn the wheel, he get shot in the neck. As he fall, he let go the wheel.
Arka : Avoid the volley of arrows (knock down the Sword Rack) / See Kanon body fall on ground
Zevlor : Avoid the volley of arrows / See Kanon get hitNodeContext: Caught by suprise, Like loosing his best friend

PleaAtTheGate.text:
CinematicNodeContext: A11 - A12 - 
Aradin : Try to open the gate by hand / let go the grip and step back /Turn around by impact / See where the threat is now
Barth : Try to open the gate by hand / let go the grip and step back / Turn around by impact / See where the threat is now
Remira : Try to open the gate by hand / let go the grip and step back / Turn around by impact / See where the threat is now

Barth : Try to open the gate by hand / let go the grip and step back / Turn around by impact / See where the threat is now
Remira : Try to open the gate by hand / let go the grip and step back / Turn around by impact / See where the threat is now

CinematicNodeContext: A13 - Worg : Hungry / start advancing
Goblins : Screaming / Charging / passing by the Worg and the cameras (for some)NodeContext: Hungry for human flesh
PleaAtTheGate.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A13 - Worg : Hungry / start advancing
Goblins : Screaming / Charging / passing by the Worg and the cameras (for some)NodeContext: Hungry for human flesh

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Barth : From his position on his last shot, he get into his fighting stance
Aradin : From his position on his last shot, he get into his fighting stance
Remira : From her position on her last shot, she get into her fighting stance

AD_WyllCharge.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllCharge.text: By sickle and sword, strike them down!

Adventurer1.speaker: Barth
Adventurer1.text: Damn coward's got plenty to answer for.
Adventurer1.context: NodeContext: Goblins are defeated, but party isn't behind the gates yet.

AdventurerLeader.speaker: Aradin
AdventurerLeader.text: Out of my way. I'll tear the horns off that bloody coward!
AdventurerLeader.context: NodeContext: Furious at Zevlor, who nearly locked him out of the grove.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: Said it from the start. Shouldn't have trusted those foulbloods.
Adventurer2.context: NodeContext: Very nasty. All-but-saying a slur re: tieflings

AD_GoblinCaptain.speaker: Za'krug
AD_GoblinCaptain.text: Scouts - get to the high ground. Raiders - charge the bastards!
AD_GoblinCaptain.context: NodeContext: Shouting commands to his troops as they enter combat

AD_GoblinCaptain.speaker: Za'krug
AD_GoblinCaptain.context: NodeContext: A warcry to his new god, the Absolute

AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.text: The danger has passed - for now. Open the gates.
AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a high pointl

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.text: Open up or I'll break the bloody thing down!

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.text: Look - please, just let us in. They're almost on us.
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.context: NodeContext: Still angry but trying to be reasonable.

VB_ApproachingGate.speaker: Player
VB_ApproachingGate.text: We should check it out - but be careful.

AD_Adventurer1AtGate.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer1AtGate.text: Hurry! Please! The goblins are on us!
AD_Adventurer1AtGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking up at Zevlor.NodeContext: Panicked and terrified. About to die.

AD_WyllWantsOut.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllWantsOut.text: Bastards. The Blade comes for you.
AD_WyllWantsOut.context: NodeContext: This should be cried out valiantly! Wyll has arrived to save the day!

AD_AdventurerLeaderRant.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderRant.context: NodeContext: If Zevlor is dead, Aradin sees his corpse

AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation.text: One less demon to worry about.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue.text: You led them to our door.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue.text: And you was ready to let 'em have us.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue.text: Don't blame me for your idiotic mistakes.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue.text: I blame you for lockin' us out. Leavin' us to die.

VB_PeacefulResolution.speaker: Player
VB_PeacefulResolution.context: NodeContext: A massive argument has just died down thanks to you. You're relieved and also surprised at how tense it was. Commenting on situation.

VB_PeacefulResolution.speaker: Player
VB_PeacefulResolution.text: Yes. It's a good thing we were here.

session_synopses.AD_Adventurer2AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PleaAtTheGate: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.
session_synopses.AD_WyllCharge: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.
session_synopses.Adventurer1: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.
session_synopses.AdventurerLeader: Minor dialogues before and after Aradin/ Zevlor's confrontation insider the camp.
session_synopses.Adventurer2:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She‚Äôs sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinCaptain: A goblin veteran leading a raid on a druid grove - he's giving orders to his troops
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened: The tiefling leader calls for the doors to be opened with an AD if players are outside of dialog range.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate: Plea from the adventurer leader at the gates - goblins are almost here, he needs Zevlor to open up! Zevlor is being circumspect.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderRant: Rant the tiefling leader says before going off to meet the adventurers after the goblin raid.
session_synopses.VB_ApproachingGate: VB played when the players are approaching the gates of the DEN.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer1AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.AD_WyllWantsOut: AD used by Wyll when his first combat turn against the goblin raiders start. This should be cried out valiantly! Wyll has arrived to save the day!
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderRant: Complaint the adventurer leader says after the goblins have been dealt with, before returning to the Den after the gates are opened.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation: AD the adventurer leader says just before running into the Den to confront the tiefling leader.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersArgue: Argument that loops over itself while the leader await the arrival of the player. They are both furious and high-energy, having just survived the goblin encounter.
session_synopses.VB_PeacefulResolution: VB if everyone survived the confrontation in Raiding Party.

session_synopses.DEN_PleaAtTheGate_Adventurers: World behaviours for Aradin and the group, they are banging at the gate

session_synopses.AD: Idle ADs for the tiefling blacksmith.

PAD_MuralHint.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_MuralHint.text: That mural... they look like Dark Justiciars.

session_synopses.PAD_MuralHint: Shadowheart notices the mural in the druid's grove.

Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.speaker: Za'krug
Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.text: I'll bleed every last one of you!

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Did that...? No, damn it. Still nothing.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Maybe - maybe it just needs time to wear off. Fingers crossed the goblins don't return any time soon.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: You. Saw you fighting those slimy bastards.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowl in hand, paused mid preperation of gruel. Next to a pot with a ladle in hand. Looking at the player, appears annoyed. NodeContext: Gruff sounding. Shouldn't be clear if you're annoyed at the player or not.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds the bowl out to the player. Nods towards it, doesn't expect to be refused. NodeContext: Gruff as you hand the food to the player. Doesn't expect the player to refuse.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Best to fill your belly now - while we still can.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding the bowl out. NodeContext: Warmth to her voice despite the gruff exterior. She's obviously concerned about the player but is hiding it.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Suit yourself, but the only way we'll make it to Baldur's Gate is to run, and run hard.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards her. NodeContext: Player has turned down your food. You're annoyed but hiding it with indifference.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: If a gnoll catches your scent, you'll need every bit of strength. Trust me.

AD_TieflingGuard1.speaker: Rikka
AD_TieflingGuard1.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's staring at the dead below.NodeContext: Shocked and scared.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.NodeContext: Mumbled - he's still half asleep and doesn't want to wake up. Can be said with a yawn, and have a snore after it.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Player
ElevatorBear.text: Could you move just a little bit? I need to use the elevator.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sluggishly gets up and moves.NodeContext: long groan, then she agrees to move - she's still very sleepy.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper.text: You're scared of a few goblins? Pathetic.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Aradin's back with his tail between his legs. I'm glad for your help, but I'd hoped you were Halsin.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard4.text: Sounds like you've crossed paths with Aradin before.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Yeah, when he ran off with the druid that saved our hides the first time.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Without Halsin... this grove's not so friendly, I'll tell you that.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: O Sel√ªne, Our Lady of Silver.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying for her dead friend. The goddess she addresses is Selune (seh-LOON-eh)

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: Please, may he rest by Your side.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying over the body of her dead friend

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He always knew what to say... when I was homesick.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He never let it show, but he was homesick, too.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.text: *Here lies Zevlor. He saved us when all hope seemed lost. Thank you, friend.*
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

AD_TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_TieflingGuard10.text: Goblins, gnolls... so many ways to die.
AD_TieflingGuard10.context: NodeContext: Morbid jokes about how to die - jovial.

PAD_ShadowheartBook.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBook.text: A temple of Shar? Where? And what's this about a curse?
PAD_ShadowheartBook.context: NodeContext: First she's heard of this temple.

PAD_BearStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_BearStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Forest Father, we are granted balance.*

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: Try it again. I dare you.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: You barged in without an invitation. I wouldn't call that friendly.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: See, you're in my territory. And I want you gone.

Squirrel.speaker: Player
Squirrel.text: Back off, squirrel. Or I'll make you.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: Okay, okay, calm down. We can make a deal.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: How about this - you can stay if you keep those ugly feet on the ground.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: I'll even sweeten the pot. Found some weird smelling stuff on the ground. You can keep it. But...
Squirrel.context: NodeContext: sweet but an edge to your voice at the end. You're about to threaten.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: The trees are mine. Follow the rules, and I won't have to intervene. Got it?

PAD_EntranceStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_EntranceStatue.text: *This grove is kept by Silvanus' faithful.*

GruntingKid_Hideout.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_Hideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: with a nod of greetingNodeContext: abrupt greeting

Refugee4.speaker: Toron
Refugee4.text: We should get moving. Goblins are bound to regroup eventually.
Refugee4.context: NodeContext: Glimmer of hope. Eager to get moving.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.context: NodeContext: Putting on a good front, but slightly afraid. Should still sound confident though.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: My friend's blood not enough? Come to rip me open too?
TieflingGuard11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tiefling raises his weapon half-heartedly.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard11.text: I fought for your people at the gate. Show some gratitude.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: You did not fight to aid us. You simply craved the taste of blood.

AD_Adventurer02.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02.text: Damn this. Damn them. Damn everything.

VB_Grave_Kanon.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_Kanon.text: *Here lies Kanon. He gave his life defending others. He will be missed.*
VB_Grave_Kanon.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

Rat.speaker: Narrator
Rat.text: *The rat's eyes soften as he emits a pained squeak.*

Rat.speaker: Narrator
Rat.text: *You realise the source of his discomfort - one of his front teeth is chipped.*

Rat.speaker: Player
Rat.text: Bare your own teeth at him.

Rat.speaker: Narrator
Rat.text: *The rat bristles with an offended hiss.*

AD_TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TieflingGuard4.context: NodeContext: Sighing, she's walking around and noticing more problems than solutions in the grove that has become a refugee camp for her people

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: How do you drow do that - find pleasure in killing? I got a goblin myself, yesterday. Shot her through the throat.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's closed off, crossing one arm over the other to hug herself, uncomfortable with what she did.

Tiefling001.speaker: Player
Tiefling001.text: Just embrace it - the adrenaline, the excitement, the power. It makes you stronger.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: I don't know if I want that. But... if that's how I get through this...
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: She was advised to lean into her sadistic urges and enjoy killing, She's a little hesitant, but willing to try it if that's what it takes.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Used to think the goblins'd kill us the second we set foot outside. But after hearing what you did at the gate...

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: ... well, I still think they'll kill us. But at least we can put up a fight.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Try not to keel over with the first blade drawn.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Well, we came through Avernus. We might not look it, but we're tough.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Who knows, some of us might even make it to Baldur's Gate.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Maybe you'll catch a glimpse of Baldur's Gate before they cut you down.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Ohh, well aren't you an optimist?

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: I've seen what the goblins can do to a vulnerable caravan, so I'm not as confident.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: But if you are, why not put a little gold on the line? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: No? Shame, I thought you might enjoy a little fun.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Be safe out there, whatever comes your way.

PAD_WolfStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_WolfStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Treefather, our turmoil is calmed.*

AD_TieflingGuard3.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3.text: What I'd do for some salt...
AD_TieflingGuard3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over cooking pot - cooking. NodeContext: Slightly gruff. Talking to herself.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Another one. What are you under there, then? Ant? Aurochs?

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: The keepers of this place. They change their form to fit their need.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: They become birds, to hunt on the wing. Bears, to tear flesh with teeth. But for me - only oxen. Only same old hay.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: And I cannot even eat it, because the horned ones hide their shiny bits inside.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Your kind give us your burdens. But who will carry ours?

GruntingKid.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid.text: *He stares right past you as if you're invisible. Or boring.*

GruntingKid.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid.context: CinematicNodeContext: noddingNodeContext: A YES grunt.

GruntingKid.speaker: Player
GruntingKid.text: Turn around to see what has his attention.

GruntingKid.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid.text: *You see nothing out of the ordinary.*
GruntingKid.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a full turn-around. The character should credibly be able to see the grunting kid out of the corner of their eye.

GruntingKid.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid.text: *As you turn back, the child slips between the rocks.*

AD_Refugee4.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee4.text: Can't keep the goblins out forever. This is no fortress, and we're no warriors.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: We've known enough grief this tenday, traveller.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: Don't be the cause of more.

AD_Refugee1.speaker: Eramas
AD_Refugee1.text: Is that everything? I think that's everything...

AD_TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard8.text: Should be safe to travel now.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *Freshly turned soil shifts beneath your feet as you approach the grave.*
GraveDig.context: NodeContext: The player has approached the grave of the very recently deceased.

GraveDig.speaker: Player
GraveDig.text: Look around cautiously, then dig with your hands.
CinematicNodeContext: Player looks left, then right and then kneels down. Claws at the dirt in an attempt to dig but quickly becomes frustrated and stops as it's not really doing anything.
GraveDig.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks left, then right and then kneels down. Claws at the dirt in an attempt to dig but quickly becomes frustrated and stops as it's not really doing anything.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *Your fingers claw at the dirt, losing purchase. If only you had a tool for this.*

session_synopses.TieflingGuard5: She drank a potion given to her by the hag, with the promise that it would make her strong as steel. It did, but it has paralysed her legs. The effects are temporary, but she's angry and embarassed at the situation she's found herself. She doesn't suspect any foul play on the hag's part. We get a clue about this mysterious old woman selling potions in the cave, and through tagged gameplay can reveal that she's been duped. She is frustrated at herself - she wanted to help in the goblin fight, and instead she is sprawled on the ground.
session_synopses.RefugeeChef: An older woman, responsible for feeding an entire camp of refugees before they leave. She is gruff but has a heart of gold. She offers the player some gruel. Purpose is to highlight how desperate their situation is.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard1: AD for a shelshocked tiefling patrolling the bridge and looking at the dead below. Older tiefling.
session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorUnusable: VB when the player clicks on the elevator, but it's blocked by the bear lying on top of it.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: A bear is sleeping on the elevator, blocking it off from use. She's very tired and doesn't want to get up
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Tiefling in charge of operating the gate at the druid's grove. She saw goblins attack and saw the player(s) help to repel them. She's nervous that more attacks will be coming and that the grove's defenses won't hold, which makes her eager to get on the road to Baldur's Gate as soon as possible.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard4: Non-critpath. A tiefling who sees the confrontation with a human adventurer at the grove as part of a systemic prejudice against tieflings. He carelessly led goblins to a grove full of tiefling children, and she doesn't think he'd have done that if there were humans there.
session_synopses.AD_CorpseMove: Two tieflings standing over the body of their killed comrade, about to bury him. Rikka is frustrated and angry in her grief, Kaldani tries to be the voice of reason.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_TieflingLeader: This is the grave of Zevlor, the tiefling leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBook: Shadowheart reads a book in the druid grove that suggests theres' a temple dedicated to her patron goddess somewhere in the region.
session_synopses.PAD_BearStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.Squirrel: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the squirrel communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the squirrel speaks like a human. She shouldn't sound like a disney animal. She's serious about getting the player to leave - she sees them as a threat - but she's also cocky about it. She doesn't think she'll have any problem beating the player the player to a pulp.Players encounter the squirrel in the druid grove. For all he knows, they're encroaching on HER territory, and she wants them out. Players have several options to deal with him in SwA - persuading or intimidating her. In both versions, they can kick her to death, if they choose.
session_synopses.PAD_EntranceStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.GruntingKid_Hideout: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts in the thiefling hiedout.
session_synopses.Refugee4: A refugee, anxious about the goblins beyond the gates and the druids within.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard11: Tiefling is afraid of githyanki - he's seen one gut his friend while they were scouting.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer02: A gruff adventurer complains about being stuck in a grove full of refugees. Wants to get back to the city. Speaking to himself. Grumbling.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_Kanon: This is the grave of Kanon, the tiefling who died at the gate of the grove. He was killed by goblins. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.AD_Gatekeeper: A tiefling refugee stands watch on a battlement, unnerved and unsettled. Also has a line for her relief when the danger is gone - 'we can finallly leave'.
session_synopses.Rat: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the rat communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the rat speaks like a human. He can have some rat-like tendencies in hs delivery, but he shouldn't have a squeaky voice or come across comical.Players encounter the rat in the druid grove. He's in pain, with a chipped tooth. He chipped it on an item in a nearby chest. If players are nice to him, he'll lead them to the chest. If players remove the item, the rat excitedly jumps into the chest.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard4: Thie tiefling refugee is trying to keep an optimistic view of things, but as she walks around the grove that they're using as a shelter, she sees too many problems and not enough solutions
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This tiefling recently killed a goblin and is trying to progress the grueling death she caused. She's trying to be strong, but is deeply traumatized. Depending on the player's answer, she'll express her frustration at not being able to deal with it,be shocked, or sink deeper into depression.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard10: A Tiefling in the druid grove who's keen to banter and joke. She's a bit flirtatious, though there's an undercurrent of fear throughout it all. She's genuinely afraid that she's going to die, and her only coping mechanism is to joke about it - in this case offering to make a bet. She's looking for something to look forward to.RERECORD NOTES: All lines in that dialogue have been set to rerecord with a few line changes. Overall direction. she needs to a more tongue in cheek humorous delivery.
session_synopses.PAD_WolfStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard3: Okta is leaning over her cooking pot, trying to make something edible as she mutters to herself.
session_synopses.Mule1: The ox is waiting in the cave while the tieflings decide whether to return to the road or not. He has been watching the druids in the grove below, and how they can change into any form they wish. He's wistful and sulky, wishing he could change his own shape from an ox to something less subservient.He can give us a hint about an item stashed in his hay.
session_synopses.GruntingKid: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts. He will disappear into a hidden hatch in the ground the first time he's encountered. He will return a day later and the player can convince him to reveal the hidden entrance if they're careful.
session_synopses.AD_GruntingKid: General, casual grunt from grunting kid while he's under normal circumstances in the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee4: Waiting for an attack of goblins on the druid grove. On edge.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard8: A stoic guard. You're a stranger in his camp, and he warns you no to cause trouble. They've already lost a lot of people.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee1: Preparing to go to Baldur's Gate, wondering what to bring.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard8: Ikaron either comments on the fact that the goblins have been defeated, or that they tiefligns have already bene attacked.
session_synopses.GraveDig: This occurs in the DEN. The dead can be Kanon, Aradin or Zevlor. It is a recently made grave.

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.text: Don't be grumpy, Rolan. We'll get to the city soon.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.context: NodeContext: You are grumpy but few can cheer you up like Cal can.

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.text: The scowl on your face would frighten a troll.
AD.context: NodeContext: A big smile as you tease Rolan, knowing you're cheering him up.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.context: NodeContext: Despite your best efforts a smile breaks out on your face - you tease Cal back.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I can spare but a moment - Baldur's Gate awaits! Oh, I can almost smell the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Leaving for Baldur's Gate after a hell of an argument but isn't bothered. Excited to be leaving and seems oblvious to that fact that Lia is next to him, SEETHING.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're cheerful for someone about to abandon his kin.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Well, you're here, aren't you? You can help them if you want.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I don't believe in sacrifices for a lost cause.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: We're leaving for Baldur's Gate. And we will make it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: There's every chance you'll die on the road.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Please. I can handle myself. It's others that are the issue.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: You are looking at Lorroakan's newest apprentice.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Excited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Yes - that Lorroakan. The greatest wizard in Baldur's Gate.
node_data.context: NodeContext: xcited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You sound excited.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I've admired Lorroakan for years. Never dreamed he'd answer my letter.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eyes light up as he discusses his hero. He looks and sounds younger in this moment. Pure enthusiasm and excitement.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: But I've worked myself to the bone for this. Few can match me - in either magic or talent.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Determined even as he's sounding overconfident. He has truly has worked his ass off to get here.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: The names 'Rolan' and 'Lorroakan' will be known far and wide. You'll see.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Those goblins will rue the day they chose to tangle with this grove.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: You and I will do some good here - I can feel it.

session_synopses.Dead: Rolan has been killed. Even in corpse form, his desire to become the greatest wizard in all of Faerun is clear.
session_synopses.AD: This occurs betwen Lia, Cal and Ronan. There are mixed ADs which occur - when they're arguing about when to stay and go, when they've decided to stay and when they've decided to go.
session_synopses: This occurs after the argument with Lia. If they're leaving for Baldur's Gate he's pretty relaxed about the argument and dismissive of Lia and her concerns. If they're staying in the grove, he's furious and is convinced they'll die here.
session_synopses.Sister: This occurs after the argument betwen Lia and Rolan. Lia is still stewing after the fight. Opportunity to get to know her better and understand the group dynamics.

AD_1.speaker: Danis
AD_1.text: Hope the road isn't too bad.

session_synopses.AD_1: This will be Danis' AD if Bex is separated from him, possibly by being dead, possibly just by being occupied. He is a bit uneasy because of this, in any case.

PAD_Comment.speaker: Player
PAD_Comment.text: Looks like the ritual worked. The whole grove is walled in.
PAD_Comment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Sad. tieflings trapped inside.

PAD_Attack.speaker: Player
PAD_Attack.text: It'd take an age to hack through all this.

session_synopses.PAD_Comment: This VB plays when players first see the results of a druid ritual: indestructible vines have enveloped the entire grove, sealing it off from the outside world. Players cannot get past them to the grove within.
session_synopses.PAD_Attack: This VB plays when players attack the indestructible vines that have enveloped a druid's grove.

DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolTampered.text: The Idol of Silvanus! Round up the intruders - we've been patient enough.

CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.speaker: GROUP_Civilians, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Guards, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Tiefling
CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.text: The goblin is escaping! Kill it!

session_synopses.DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolTampered: AD when the druids realise their sacred idol has been tampered with. This is the straw that breaks the camel's back, and they start attacking the tieflings and the players.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime: Assorted residents of the Druid Grove react to a goblin prisoner having broken free.

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.text: I told them to run, the idiots.

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.text: You better turn north here, or you'll end up like them.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Ah, the fighting foulblood. Glad to know one of you has a spine.
RaidAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: She cleans her wound, a cut on her arm with a [cleaning cloth]

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: I already regret saving your life.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Ah - bruised your feelings, did I? Excuse me if I don't weep - got problems of my own.
RaidAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: My arm's near hanging off after wise Zevlor left us to die at the gate.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: And then he has the bloody gall to try and blame it all on us.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: He let you in, didn't he? It could have been worse.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: You're trying to be gracious and she's not having any of it.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: We expected a soft job. Something to test the new lad, maybe, but not a bloody goblin nest.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: She's justifying her actions - they'd taken on a job that seemed simple but quickly got out of hand. People died and she's doggedly maintaining that she's the victim. More explanatory than whiny, though.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Most would've turned tail at the sight. But not Liam, no - he charged them, the stupid bastard.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: She's genuinely hurt at the loss of this recruit but projecting a knowing persona to hide it, as if his bravery is somehow a rookie mistake. Note of incredulity rather than laughing at him, as if he did something very stupid.

VB_AtCorpses.speaker: Player
VB_AtCorpses.text: I wonder where they were going.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: You shouldn't have brought Liam along. Lad was too young.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: Everyone needs to cut their teeth sometime.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: Cut his teeth?! For his sake, I hope he's dead already.

session_synopses.RaidAdventurerAtCorpses: The adventurer is standing next to the corpses of her comrades she left behind while running for the goblins.
session_synopses.RaidAdventurer:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She‚Äôs sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.VB_AtCorpses: Remarking on corpses on the road.
session_synopses.AD_AradinAndRemira: Aradin and Remira are having a drink after arriving back in the Druid Grove.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerCleaningWound: Remira is cleaning a wound she got from the goblins. She winces and grunts in pain while checking out the damage.

VB_FishOutofWater.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater.text: These tieflings prove fragile. I've a mind to end their misery myself.

VB_FishOutofWater.speaker: Player
VB_FishOutofWater.text: Calm yourself. They're survivors, not soldiers.

VB_FishOutofWater.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater.text: I fail to see the distinction.

session_synopses.VB_FishOutofWater: Lae'zel remarks on the tieflgins' frailty, and the party responds.

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Narrator
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: *It seems Mol was as good as her word. She's reported that you've been threatening children.*

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Player
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: Children? I haven't spoken to any children.

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Narrator
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: *Your words may be false, but they ring truer than Mol's tales. You're off the hook.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *Your rescue attempt has been noticed. Choose your next move carefully.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Player
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: Anyone who wants to hurt Sazza will face me first.

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *You are persuasive enough. You, and the goblin, are free to go.*

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Narrator
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: *The druids will not stand by while you abscond with their idol. Your next move will decide your fate.*

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Player
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: Apologise. You were mistaken to touch their holy relic.
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.context: InternalNodeContext: No evidence was found. Can happen if everything that was stolen was stackable, e.g. gold, and was merged with existing stacks in the player's inventory

session_synopses.Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when a guard confronts players who have offended Mol, teenage crime boss in the Druid Grove. The player can try talk their way out of trouble, attempt a bribe, fight or surrender.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player is trying to smuggle the goblin out of the Druid Grove.
session_synopses.GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft: This dialog triggers when you attempt to move or steal the idol.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Another outsider? This place has certainly become popular.
005.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arron turns around and wipes his hands on his trousers (he was standing at a table, with his back to the player).

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Well met, and thank you for beating back those goblins. Most brave of you.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Is there anything you need? Act fast if you do - the ritual will be complete before too long.

005.speaker: Player
005.text: What ritual are you talking about?

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Ah - I forgot you're a blow-in. A few days hence, this grove will be completely concealed by thorny vines.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: None will be able to enter - or leave.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: A drastic measure. But more monsters seem to terrorise this region every day.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: We druids will be safe. As for those that took refuge here... well, may Silvanus guard them as they continue their travels.

005.speaker: Player
005.text: Seems like most are tieflings. They'll be fine. They have devilish powers.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Ignorance is agony, my friend. I will include you in my prayers. I'd better get started - for your sake.

003.speaker: Loic
003.text: Shadow Druids... To think we were rotting from within. I'm sorry. I need a moment.
003.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: Add Shadow Druid Flag. Reaction for after the player exposed the Shadow druid plot. I don't know if he'll be part of the druids who fight alongside Sagha (I don't know if all pro-sagha druids do). But this works both if Sagha got convinced and if she's dead.NodeContext: They just discovered that their boss was being influenced by an evil organisation.

session_synopses.005: Arron is a friendly, but tired servant to the druids in the grove. Unless the player is a druid, he would rather they don't linger, though he is sympathetic and will help them any way he can (by selling them supplies). He is happy to see a druid and to help them. He can be a little preachy.
session_synopses.003: An elderly druid who would like nothing more than for the player to leave. Depending on what the player has done, he will be civil about it, but still incistent. If the child has died, he is openly hostile.

Bear.speaker: Bosk
Bear.text: Come on... all the druids can understand me, you can - why can't the man with the pen?

Bear.speaker: Bosk
Bear.context: NodeContext: Articulating very clearly - he's trying to make someone who can't speak with animals understand what he's saying.

Bear.speaker: Narrator
Bear.text: *The man nods thoughtfully and adds another dismembered limb to his sketch.*

session_synopses.Bear: Bear in the druid grove. This is a Speak with Animals dialogue. If Volo is there, we sense his frustration at trying to communicate with Volo (who has been asking him questions in an AD). If Volo isn't there, he wants to know who we are. He gets scared of us when we tell him about the tadpole.

session_synopses.AD: AD of very lazy bear in the water.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: You came! I have - here! Mol said I should thank you properly. For the harpies.
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: The kid takes something out of his back pocket. If you can suggest that he's holding a pageoff-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: So I wrote you a story!
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: If you can suggest that he's offering the player a page off-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Player
InHideout.text: I've heard enough of your chatter. I don't need more.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: Oh. Umm... okay, I'll... keep it.
InHideout.context: NodeContext: The player refused his gift, saying it's junk

AfterHarpyEncounter.speaker: Mirkon
AfterHarpyEncounter.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cowering in fear (he's hunkering down, with his hands over his face/ears). Scripter note: Use the generic cower or some approximation for consistency with scripter animations.

AfterHarpyEncounter.speaker: Player
AfterHarpyEncounter.text: They're gone. Are you all right?

VB_PlayerWarnings.speaker: Player
VB_PlayerWarnings.context: NodeContext: wondering, a little bit in awe.

CharmedVictim.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedVictim.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome isn't looking at the player, but in the direction the singing comes from.NodeContext: in awe, entranced. Trying not to disturb the singer.

VB_FoundHarpyNest.speaker: Player
VB_FoundHarpyNest.text: A giant nest... let's see what we can find.
VB_FoundHarpyNest.context: NodeContext: They enter the nest and smell the offal the harpies left behind.

session_synopses.InHideout: You encounter the kid you saved from the harpies in the children's hideout. He wants to thank you, but is still a little shy.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerCharmed: AD when the player is charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.AfterHarpyEncounter: Non-critical path. The player has just saved the child from harpies that had enchanted and tried to eat him. He's shy and still scared.
session_synopses.VB_PlayerWarnings: AD played when the player gets close to the harpy situation, warning them that something is amiss.
session_synopses.CharmedVictim: Non-critical path. Unless the player has snapped him out of it, the boy will be enchanted and wanting to get closer to the source of the song.
session_synopses.AD_GnomeCharmed: The tiefling kid has been charmed, and is being controlled by a beautiful song that beckons him forth, promising everything will be all right if he follows.
session_synopses.VB_FoundHarpyNest: VB when the player finds the Harpy's nest
session_synopses.AD_GnomeUncharmed: The tiefling kid wakes up fron his trance, he's panicked and (almost) crying because he's so frightened.

PAD_AfterKid.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_AfterKid.text: This Zorru has encountered githyanki. I must find and question him.

session_synopses.PAD_AfterKid: Lae'zel avatar remarks on the kid who recognised her as a githyanki

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: Lives are at stake, and the cowards only care about their bloody rituals!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player re; the druids, who are still relatively close.

Protester3.speaker: Xeph
Protester3.text: This place ain't so special. Why were the druids so protective of it?
Protester3.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: Stop! Move back at once.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Player is in the trigger S_DEN_PondTrespassBox

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: You - get back.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jeorna (druid1) turns to address the player.NodeContext: Entry not up for discussion.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm not looking for trouble. Can't you just let me by?
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: New node post-EA (GUS-149709)

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: No. And you'll find trouble all the same, unless you get out of my sight.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: New node post-EA (GUS-149709)

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: Keep back. Force my hand, and I'll show you its claws.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bear-druid glowers menacingly when druid says 'show you its claws'.NodeContext: Final warning.

node_data.speaker: Mino
node_data.text: A moment, Jeorna.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mino  interjects, approaching Jeorna's side.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: What...? Oh. I understand.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mino whispers something inaudible to Jeorna, who glances at you with realisation of something.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: You - apparently Kagha wants to see you. Go ahead.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jeorna's attention is fully with the player again. She waves them through the checkpoint.NodeContext: Sudden change of tone. She bruskly allows the player to pass.

Protester2.speaker: Amek
Protester2.text: Looks like the druids have eased off some. Small mercies.
Protester2.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
ParentsScene.text: She's a thief, hellspawn. And you will wait for Kagha's judgement. Now get back.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over her - roaring in her faceNodeContext: Snapping back at the woman. The child is a thief and a liar as far as you're concerned. Right in her face as you snap at her to get back,

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Argh. Let me through, mragreshem, or I'll rip your damned throat out!
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Move as if to push past the guardsNodeContext: You've lost your temper, you're pushing past - utterly furious

ParentsScene.speaker: Maggran
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transform into a bear. Stamping the ground and roaring - the tieflings jumpe back wards.NodeContext: Roar in rage as you transform into a bear

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: Damn it. We could have taken those guards.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: I'd rather you not get eaten by a bear.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.Protester1: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.Protester3: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses: Three druids guard the entrance to the inner part of their sanctuary, blocking any outsiders. They're on edge, having recently driven back some outraged tiefling refugees who know the druids hold one of their children captive. One of the druids transformed into a bear during this confrontation, causing the tieflings to back down. Now we try to gain passage while tempers are still running hot.
session_synopses.Protester2: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.ParentsScene: Marricko and Locke are trying to force their way past multiple guards to get into the inner grove. Their daughter was taken by the druids and stands accused of thievery. This is a tense scene - the threat of violence close to the surface. Their daughter is NOT present - she is in the inner chambers of the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsLeaving: Parents have just walked away from guards after being threatened. The situation has dissolved but they are tense - the wife in particular.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsSeeCorpse: This is the edgecase in which the player takes Arabella's corpse and dumps it in front of her parents. They are hysterical with grief.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: If it ain't the friendly drow. Thought you were with the goblins when you showed up at the gate.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Glad you weren't - you fight well. Not like them bloody tieflings.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I think they like you less than they like me. It's almost impressive, how detestable you are.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Thanks, mum. Now please do feck off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Thick with sarcasm

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Charming. I can see why the locals like you so much.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Them devils ain't local - they're refugees. Fella who runs this place offered 'em shelter.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Not my concern. Is there a healer round these parts?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: You're outta luck. Halsin - druid who runs this place - knew his stuff. But he ain't here anymore.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Think he's got an apprentice running around somewheres though. Nadine? Natalie? Something like that.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Do you have any idea where Halsin went?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Aye. His name's Halsin, and if he's still alive, he'll be cursing the day he laid eyes on me.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: We've got a contract to track down some relic, and he wanted in on the job. Eyes lit up when he heard about it.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Didn't work out, though. Goblins got him when we were turning tail. He's either diggin' latrines or boilin' in a cookpot by now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Can I have a look at that contract?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Job's all yours, if you got a death wish.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'You can have it, buddy'

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: There's a wizard in Baldur's Gate that'll pay gobloads for a relic, supposedly buried round these parts.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: But gold ain't any use if you're too cold to spend it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Flippant

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Just tell me where to find the relic.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: It's called the Nightsong. Supposed to be hidden under the temple where the goblins jumped us.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: I'd give you the map and wish you a happy funeral, but my mate Brian kept hold of it like his own todger. Goblins made short of the fat old chunk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Disrespectful

session_synopses: Adventurer leader dialogue. Mostly used during Adventurers Quest. This is after the player has stopped Zevlor and Aradin from fighting one another. Aradin returns to his den to lick his wounds.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: The Shadow Druids are taking over - the circle is overdue some change.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: The child is to blame. She shouldn't have stolen in the first place.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Preventable. The sickening result of sickening beliefs.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: We let this happen. We let this snake replace our leader.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: A deep elf - in our grove, on this day. A sign. Or rather, a gift.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: Who better to understand a watchful broodmother than a beloved child of Lolth?

Leader.speaker: Player
Leader.text: I'd have killed the thief outright.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: Yes. Yes. This could be the true way of Silvanus.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: The viper bares her fangs defending her brood. It is only right that she strike the killing blow.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: The others might consider this sacrilege. But we know the truth: it is necessity.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: I took back the Idol of Silvanus and the rite has resumed. We will seal the grove. Free from harm. Free of intruders.

LeaderSaved.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved.text: I have been so blind, that an outsider would show me the way of Silvanus.

LeaderSaved.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved.text: After all I've done, you've no reason to believe me, but... I'm grateful.

LeaderSaved.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved.text: I will cancel the rite and subject myself to the circle for judgement.

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *You consider the Rite of Thorns. A rare art, plucked from illicit domains.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Player
SelfReflection.text: Think back to your teachings. What are the rite's perils?

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *When the prayer ends, vines curl upwards from the earth and thorns sprout forth.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *Those within are isolated and those without, rejected. Isolation breeds violence. Few circles survive it.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *There is more to Kagha's tale. The grove must hide her secrets.*

AD_OpposedPacified.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified.text: So much death. So little justice.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Player
LeaderPostGoblins.text: Halsin is dead. I thought you should know.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: He turned his back on the circle to stumble after the past. How fitting that it's consumed him.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: Well. A broodmother looks forward, never back. I am First Druid now. And I will keep my children safe.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.Opposed: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.
session_synopses.AD_CallWolf: Silver, Rath's wolf companion, is wandering away from him. He calls the wolf back. Patient and affectionate tone.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.Leader: Player speaks with Kagha, the secret Shadow druid. Various paths of conversation reflect whether Kagha's actions led to a child's death or not. She may be neutral/Machiavellian or pure evil, depending.
session_synopses.LeaderSaved: Kagha's dialog after the Celebration (post-AttackOnDen or post-GoblinHunt), if the scene with the parents occured and the player saved her.CAMP_GoblinHuntCelebration_Event_SavedKagha = true
session_synopses.SelfReflection: Following Kagha's dialogue, if druid player asked about the rite and has not already discovered the shadow druid connection, they experience a self-reflection. There is more to this tale; you should search Kagha's quarters. Journal entry to search her quarters appears.
session_synopses.AD_OpposedPacified: Plays after the "Denouncing Kagha" scene, when Kagha is dead. When she is alive, Rath and Kagha have an AD together
session_synopses.LeaderPostGoblins: Kagha's dialogue after the goblins' leaders are all dead and the grove enters the victory state.

003.speaker: Topaz
003.text: Shh, I'm concentrating. Does this look good? Is the coin in the middle?
003.context: NodeContext: Clearly concentrating on something else while talking to the player. He's pushing the coin around.

003.speaker: Player
003.text: Kick at the bird, trying to scare it away.

003.speaker: Topaz
003.context: NodeContext: The player just kicked the bird.

session_synopses.003: Speak with animals dialogue. A little bird is adding a coin to the shinies in his nest, but he's not confident it's looking good.
session_synopses.AD_002: animal sound AD for druid pet wolf in grove
session_synopses.AD_004: Animal sound AD for pet boar in druid grove

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

Trainee1.speaker: Umi
Trainee1.text: Oh! Uh... right. 'Go for the heart.'
Trainee1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.NodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.

AD_HideoutTrespass.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I don't have money or anything to sell. My p-partner does that.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_002.text: So what's your side of the business?

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I'm the guard? So... don't steal anything! I'm watching you!

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards.text: When do I get to run the ring scam?

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Silfy needs the practice. You'll be out there soon enough.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards.text: I bet that scam is going to kill in Baldur's Gate.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Don't get too attached to that con, kids. I got bigger plans for the city.

AD_MerchantLeaves.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

HideoutGuard_002.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

CaughtThief.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief.text: *You suddenly feel something moving against your back and turn.*
CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief.speaker: Player
CaughtThief.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Child being shaken by player. She struggles free, and a few trinkets fall to the groundNodeContext: Scared and in pain

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Escapes the player's grasp, runs away.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Hey, you're back. Here to trade?

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Hey there. You wanna buy one of my lucky rings? Bargain magic at good prices.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001.text: Drop the act. I know about your little scam.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
