Pickpocket_001.text: That hurts. It's a great big scam.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: But okay, fine. Get out of here. Make room for the chumps.

AD_CannotFitCrack.speaker: Player
AD_CannotFitCrack.text: I can't fit through here. Wonder if there's another way in.

Trainee3.speaker: Gan
Trainee3.text: This is boring. We should train against real goblins!

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I saw you at the gates. You fight well.
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: All the trainees are getting added to the dialog on this nodeNodeContext: Teacher voice.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be includedNodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: Bad news, children: you're all going to die.

Trainee2.speaker: Ide
Trainee2.text: Next time the goblins come, I'll be ready.

Trainee2.speaker: Wyll
Trainee2.text: Don't push it, kid. If you see trouble, then run. Only fight if you have to.

AD_Trespassing.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Gan
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: (ie what about her tail in combat)

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee3Responses.text: Use that too. Your entire body is a weapon.

AD_MagicTrick.speaker: Silfy
AD_MagicTrick.text: I want to learn a trick too. Something only I know.

AD_Trainee1Responses.speaker: Umi
AD_Trainee1Responses.text: Sir? Are we gonna have to fight hogboglins?
AD_Trainee1Responses.context: NodeContext: Umi says it wrong. Hog+boglin

AD_Trainee1Responses.speaker: Umi
AD_Trainee1Responses.text: Oh. Are those worse than hogboglins?

AD_KidGuardReport.speaker: Mol
AD_KidGuardReport.text: Help! They're trying to kill us!

AD_GuardAfterKnockout.speaker: Ikaron
AD_GuardAfterKnockout.context: NodeContext: aradin has been knocked out; ikaron is happy

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_CannotFitCrack: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.
session_synopses.Trainee3: Tiefling child far too confident they can fight goblins next time, even when scared.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.
session_synopses.Trainee2: Tiefling child confident they can fight goblins next time they come.
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Gan (and possibly Ide) recieve combat training from an adult tiefling. They're both tiefling girls aged 9-10. Too brave. Don't know the danger ahead.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee2Responses: Training in combat with an adult tiefling. Ide is 9-10. Nervous, but trying to be brave
session_synopses.AD_MagicTrick: Silfy tries to learn Mattis's sleight of hand tricks. Big brother indulging his younger sister.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee1Responses: Training in self-defence with an adult. Umi is 8-9 years old and timid.
session_synopses.AD_TrainerLessons: A trainer speaking to children being taught to defend themselves in a makeshift outdoor training arena.
session_synopses.AD_KidGuardReport: Player is fighting Mol and the other kids. The kids are calling for help from the other tieflings.
session_synopses.AD_GuardAfterKnockout: After the confrontation at teh gates where Zevlor and Aradin show down. Ikaron, a tiefling, is pro Zevlor.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I'm so stupid. How could I have trusted her?
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Shake and horrified - you've just survived a near death experience.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I almost gave that monster my child.
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: The true horror of what you almost did is dawning on you - giving your child to a hag.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: It was part of the deal. For him.
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Horror and grief as you recount your deal

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: My husband. She was going to bring him back. Bring Connor back to life.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: Let me know when you're done whining.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I'm more the fool for getting upset. It's likely gold you want, right?
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Resigned, bitter - you're feeling lost and alone

session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Lair: This occurs after the hag fight. Mayrina is in one of two states. In the top she is horrified, shaken and trying to calm herself. She can't believe she almost made a deal with the hag and explains her deal to the player.In the second, she is FURIOUS with the player for ruining her deal. And leaves angry with them (unless you tell her about ethel planning to eat her child.)

HagLair_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
HagLair_Victim_003.context: NodeContext: *With a gasp, the corpse shuddered.*

AD_ControlledByMask.speaker: Player
AD_ControlledByMask.text: Get out. GET OUT OF MY HEAD!
AD_ControlledByMask.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clutching head NodeContext: Panicked and afraid as the hag invades your mind. Lae'zel's line; Pa'vrylk = Stop! Pronounced; PAH-vrill-ck

AD_ControlledByMask.text: Quiet, little one. Auntie will make it all better.
AD_ControlledByMask.context: NodeContext: Soothing and cruel. A vicious insult as you take over their mind.

Lair.text: You come to my home, interfere in my business, and now have the gall to face me in the heart of my lair? You petulant bollocks.
Lair.context: NodeContext: This begins the fight. Roaring it at the player - likely on the other side of the lair. They've freed your captive and you are furious and out of blood. Fit to kill everyone in the room.

Lair.text: I'll rip your spine out your arsehole.
I'll use your blood to spice my stew.
I'll keep you alive until I've sucked the marrow from your bones.
And then I'll bring you back and do it all over again.

MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist.text: Yes, Auntie. I'll break their pretty little bones.
MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist.context: NodeContext: Wearing a mask that controls her - at this point, it's commanded her to kill the player and she revels in what she's going to do

MaskedVictim4.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4.context: NodeContext: as if drugged - hushed voice

MaskedVictim4.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4.text: Very droll, my friend. Most amusing.
MaskedVictim4.context: NodeContext:  a deranged but poltie butler

MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, trying to resist telepathic commands from the hag who is ordering them to kill the players in combat

MaskedVictim4_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, trying to resist telepathic commands from the hag who is ordering them to kill the players in combat

MaskedVictim3_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim3_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, trying to resist telepathic commands from the hag who is ordering them to kill the players in combat

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1.text: We need to leave. You're not supposed to be here - she'll be furious.
MaskedVictim1.context: CinematicNodeContext: panicked, confused, as if coming out of a stuporNodeContext: confused, afraid

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1.text: You served her - give me one good reason to let you live.

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1.text: It was the mask. It dug its roots into me... took away my will. I tried to fight it.
MaskedVictim1.context: NodeContext: explaining something she barely understands

AD_WearMask.text: Stop fighting me, petal. Let me take care of you.
AD_WearMask.context: NodeContext: You are attempting to break into someone's mind and take over from afar. Voice is low and seductive - enticing.

session_synopses.AD_ControlledByMask: The player has failed the wisdom save while wearing the mask - and fallen prey to the hag's control. Auntie Ethel takes over your mind.
session_synopses.Lair: These are fired at the very beginning of the fight with the hag - tense scene. Hag is at one end of the cavern. Mayrina is trapped in a cage in the middle. Player is on the other side.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist: Responding to a telephatic command from the hag's mask to kill the player.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim4: A victim of the hag, bound into her service for so long that their mind is almost completely lost. This one is wearing the Mask of Servitude and is brainwashed to serve the hag and her 'visitors'.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim4_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim3_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim1: A victim of the hag, forced to wear a mask that takes away her free will so that she fights for and serves the hag. If the hag is killed, this character regains her senses and resolve. She's deeply shaken by her experience, but courageous, telling the player that she'll inform the people of Baldur's Gate of our heroism, and vowing to hunt down the hag's accomplices in the city.
session_synopses.PAD_FreedFromControl: Player breaks free from the hag's control.
session_synopses.AD_WearMask: This occurs when the player puts on the hag mask and on ever subsequent 'turn' thereafter. The player must continually succeed on a wisdom save or risk the hag taking over their mind.

AD_HagCackles.context: NodeContext: A set of different cackles for Ethel. All evil. All nasty. All mean. At least three different kinds.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor.text: 'A thief who tried to steal from Auntie. Now the good little pet guards my home.'

AD_VictimSign_004.text: 'My sweet Calim, whose beloved asked that his beauty never fade.'

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.speaker: Player
PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.text: They're not attacking. Must think I'm one of them.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom Cam - Tilt Up + RotationNodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Oh no. No. Why ain't I petrified?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Panic as you realise the petrification - the thing keeping a deadly disease from spreading across your body - is gone.

Victim_001.speaker: Player
Victim_001.text: Because I saved you. You're welcome.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: But - but how? The hag said there was no cure.
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: You should be dead. You have an incurable disease. You're trying to make sense of everything.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: And that the Bite... Laduguer's Bite was fatal.
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine.

AD_VictimSign_005.text: 'This poor dear wished never to lay eyes on her family again.'

VB_BurningCage.speaker: Player
VB_BurningCage.context: NodeContext: You're trying to save a woman. She's trapped in a cage that is one fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.text: Hah! Catch me if you can, petal!
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Laughing and joking with amused menace.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You feel crushing waves of fear as a presence within the door recoils. It can't let people through. Not again!*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just a shot of the player and the door - no visions yet. Player pressing a hand to their head as waves of fear hit them.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You see the gallery, its walls lined with the hag's victims - their bodies and minds twisted beyond ruin.*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the gallery - the huddled victim in the mirror, the headless victim, the vacant bleeding eyes sockets

AD_VictimSign_002.text: 'My darling Magron. She wished for the mind of a genius, but the silly head crossed me.'

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.text: Get me out of this hellhole!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_SummonVictims.context: NodeContext: You're forcing two people to come help you in battle - it's a spell and they have no free will. Soft alluring voice as you call our to them across the room.

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead.text: Is there anything I should know about this place?

VB_MayrinaInCage.speaker: Player
VB_MayrinaInCage.context: NodeContext: You've spotted the woman you're trying to save.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I was a fool. I wanted to know my fate. I had a choice between two lives, and I was frightened of choosing wrong.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Player has asked how you ended up in the hag lair. Your voice is filled with regret.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I asked the hag to help me see what the future would hold. Got what I wished for, too.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I saw my future self - a corpse, rotten with maggots. And everyone around me dead. Putrid and dead.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Dazed horror as you recall the visions that pushed you to the brink of insanity.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed.text: You mentioned choosing between two lives. What were they?

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: A boring story. Stay or go. Marriage and kids or a life of novelty.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Your voice is filled with regret. You gave up everything because you were too afarid to make a choice.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I lost my best years rather than just... choose.

AD_VictimSign_003.text: 'My gentle Lorin. He wished to know what was to come.'

AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a cage. You're scared but determined - yelling for the fighting to stop

Victim_004.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004.text: *The mirror glints in the light - the screams from within now silent.*

VB_MirrorScreams.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams.context: NodeContext: Confused at the sound but you can't tell where it is.

PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. My, my - the mask suits you. Just relax. See the world with fresh eyes.
And let your dear old Auntie Ethel look after you.

AD_VictimSign_001.text: 'My dearest Efrin. He begged me to halt the deadly disease that ravaged him.'

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_ViciousMockery.text: Think you're a person because you're walking on two feet? Adorable.

AD_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
AD_Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: One the ground - cowering. Curled up - looking in front of you at a mirror and then ducking behind your hands. NodeContext: Panicked and afraid. You're severely traumatised and not really aware of your surroundings.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.speaker: Demir, Johl
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of a fight. The hag has assumed the form of your sister but you can tell it's fake. Calling out a warning to the player - fear in your voice.

EntranceDouble.text: You are as thick as they come, sweetness.
EntranceDouble.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

Victim_001_Dead.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead.text: I'd the Bite... Laduguer's Bite... sickness worse than... death.

Victim_001_Dead.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead.text: Hag turned me... to stone. Stopped the... spread.

VB_EnteredGallery.speaker: Player
VB_EnteredGallery.context:
NodeContext: Creeped out and horrified as you enter a 'gallery' of the hag's victims.
Shadowheart: droll.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: No... No. Don't look. Mustn'tlook. Mustn'tsee.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: No... No. Don't look. Musn'tlook. Musn'tsee.
Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting on the ground, knees up, hands moving from across knees to face as you rocking back and forth, severely traumatised and trying to hide from the worldNodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. This is quite a disturbing scene - you're clearly traumatised but trying to hold it together initially. Speaking and muttering to yourself (the image you are trying not too look at is your own corpse - rotten and broken), You are not looking at the player.

AD_HagAttacksCage.text: You want the girl so bad? Fine. Have her roasted!
AD_HagAttacksCage.context: NodeContext: You've just set the cage holding a pregnant woman prisoner on fire. Middle of a fight. Laugh and a vicious smile.

PAD_AtEntrance.speaker: Player
PAD_AtEntrance.context: NodeContext: Wyll's line: a bit sing-songy but not too much.

AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of the fight - the player has figured out which illusion is the real you and hit you. You're PISSED. Furious at the player, yelping in pain for one of them, and roaring at the player for the others. Furious, vengeful and MAD.

ControlledByMask.text: Stay with me, petal. Stay with Auntie. Forever.

AD_DoubleDied.context: NodeContext: You have created illusions of yourself. The player is attacking you - but getting the illusion instead. You're laughing and taunting them - rubbing it in their face that they can't find you.

session_synopses.AD_HagCackles: A set of different cackles for Ethel to be used in the lair.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore1: Players have wandered into the Hag Lair without Ethel being present and are commenting on the creepy environment. This is the first to fire.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor: This person has been turned into a door and is unable to speak. Sign attached to it.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_004: This person is trapped in a mirror and mute.
session_synopses.PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral: You are wearing the mask and the other masked victims do not attack you.
session_synopses.Victim_001:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_005: An eyeless woman - dead. One of the hag's victims. You're reading a sign in front of her eyeless body.
session_synopses.VB_BurningCage: This occurs when the hag sets the cage on fire.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2: The hag turns invisible and disappears during the fight.
session_synopses.TalkingDoor: The door guarding the entrance to the hag's lair. It's actually transparent and the player can walk through it. It's a cut scene as the door tries to project images onto the player and communicate to them. Pleading with them to leave. The door was a thief that was taken by Ethel and torn to shreds, with the remainder of his body transformed into a door.Much of this is a 'cut scene' as the door projects visions into the player's mind instead of communicating.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_002: A victim holding their own decapitated head in their hands. This is the sign attached to their corpse.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real: Triggered during the fight with the hag. She has sent out illusions mimicking Mayrina. The real Mayrina is trying running towards the player. Her voice and mannerisms should be a clue to the player that this is the real Mayrina.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Dead: The characters has died and player is using the 'speak with dead' spell. Character is at peace. He lived in fear of his own death. Now that it's happened, he's at peace.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake: These are fired during the fight. It's the hag pretending to be Mayrina.
session_synopses.AD_SummonVictims: Auntie Ethel summons victim_001 and victime_003 to aide her in battle.
session_synopses.Victim_005_Dead: A dialogue with the corpse of a hag victim with her eyes gouged out. She is happy to be dead-- she lived a terrible life and carried family secrets heavily upon her. Her voice should be meek and delicate. She has borne too much in this life already and is ready to be done.
session_synopses.VB_MayrinaInCage: Triggers when the player enters the lair and sees Mayrina trapped in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Freed: This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_003: This person is alive but severely traumatised and hysterical.
session_synopses.AD_SurrogateMotherInCage: ADs fire by Mayrina when she is trapped in the cage. In the first set it's when combat has started and she is cheering the player on, in the second set she just wants the player to leave her alone. In the third set the cage is on fire, and in the last the fighting is over but she's still locked in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_004: A victim of the hag's. They're trapped inside a mirror.
session_synopses.VB_MirrorScreams: Trigger near mirror - someone is trapped inside.
session_synopses.PutOnMask: Player put on mask and is hearing auntie's voice telepathically booming around them.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_001: This is the plaque that is attached to the petrified body of one of the hag's victims.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1: The fires as Ethel summons illusions of herself to confuse the player.
session_synopses.AD_ViciousMockery: The Hag will cast Vicious Mockery on the party in combat. Whoever she targets will be insulted by origin or race. If a character is targeted multiple times, another insult in the chain will be used.
session_synopses.AD_Victim_003: This is a victim of the hag. He was cursed to see the future - he's severely traumatised. In the first AD he's been summoned to fight by the hag. In the rest, he's curled up ont he ground and talking to himself. Severely traumatised.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion: The hag assumes the form of Mayrina in the boss fight. The brothers are able to tell who is Mayrina and who is the hag.
session_synopses.EntranceDouble: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.
session_synopses.Victim_001_Dead: Dialogue with dead hag victim using Speak with Dead. He's relieved to be 'free' at last after haivng lived a life petrified/ afflicted with Laduguer's Bite, a terrible illness.
session_synopses.VB_EnteredGallery: Triggers as you enter the hag gallery. It's creepy.
session_synopses.Victim_003:
This victim was cursed to see the future by the hag. In his initial dialogue, he is SEVERELY traumatised - sitting down, knees up, peeking out between his arms. He should sound quite disturbed, as if his sanity has long since deserted him.

He doesn't look at the player until halfway through the dialogue. When he looks up, he believes the player to be a monster of nightmares - a mindflayer. This is a terrifying moment for the player, as they are fighting a parasite in their head that will cause them to turn into a mindflayer.

In his dialogue in which he's met the player but has survived the hag, his gift is gone - but once he realises the player is the monster he saw before, he runs - terrified. 

In his post hag dialogue he is saddened and clearly traumatised by his time with the hag - and the thought of the life he could have led.
session_synopses.AD_HagAttacksCage: These are fired during the fight with the hag. The first occurs when Mayrina's cage is set on fire, the second if she dies.
session_synopses.PAD_AtEntrance: Combat has started with the hag. She's fled downstairs. You've gone through the fireplace and have just appeared in her lair. Furtive. Looking around for Auntie Ethel.
session_synopses.AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed: This fires during the fight with the player. The player has figured out which illusion is the real hag and hit it.
session_synopses.ControlledByMask: Hag mode. Player has failed a wisdom save while wearing the mask and the hag has taken over their mind. Cruel and triumphant. The other origin characters realise what has happened.
session_synopses.AD_DoubleDied: This fires during the fight with the hag. She's created doubles of herself and the player has attacked the double - missing her. She's taunting them.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: That the jingle of coin I hear? You've timed it well, my friend.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom CamNodeContext: Warm and welcoming (a kind of mercantile 'Who do we have here?')

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the crest she bears - the winged serpent of the Zhentarim.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera should show Crest of Zhentarim she is wearing

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What business does someone like you have in a goblin camp?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: You joking? Goblins sell the best prisoners - cheap, quiet, and eager to be elsewhere.
node_data.context: NodeContext: You've made the assumption that there's nothing worth trading with goblins - she's the expert correcting you. As if giving tips to a novice

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Till this crowd converted and started sending their captives to Moonrise Towers, at least.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Correcting herself. Tone is rueful - some of her best trading partners have fallen to organised religion.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: No complaints, mind - I just sold enough smokepowder to cover the loss ten times over.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Perking up - she still managed to make a profit. Always a bright side.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's slaves you're buying - not prisoners.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Oh dry your eyes, Ilmater. It's me or a goblin cookpot - I know which I'd choose.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Scornful but not overly so - she's more bored of your moralising than anything. Ilmater (ihl-MAY-ter) is a god of compassion and martyrdom. She has no time for your bleeding heart - she's all pragmatism.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Now - much obliged for the chat, but I'm here to trade.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Insincere about the chat - she's just Impatient to get back to the matter at hand.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Crusher
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX : The goblin bends over and kisses the player's foot
DrunkGoblin.context: CinematicNodeContext: Needs to be mocaped InternalNodeContext: Needs to be mocaped

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Tracker Kirz
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX: All surrounding Goblins cackle as the drunk goblin point out the player kissed his feet

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Tracker Kirz
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX: All surrounding Goblins menacingly cackle as the drunk goblin threatens the player

Guard.speaker: Warrior Plig
Guard.text: Steal somethin' or act the bollocks, will ya? I'm itching to throw someone in the brig. It'll be fun. I promise.
Guard.context: NodeContext: plig wants the player to act out so she can throw them in jail

PAD_TunnelBlocked.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelBlocked.text: Still blocked - but should be easy enough to clear.

session_synopses.Guard: Warrior Plig is a goblin on patrol around the wolf pens in the goblin camp. She's bored and wishing for some action.
session_synopses.PAD_TunnelBlocked: The player has pulled the body from the tunnel in the goblin prison, but it's still blocked by debris. The player can attack it if they can do enough damage (vulnrable to Force damge), are small enough to get good levrage, or shapeshifted into a badger. This AD plays to inform the player the way is still blocked and to hint at the solution.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Don't worry on the worgs, cavey. They won't eat anyfink wot grows in the ground.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Normal back-and-forth.NodeContext: Takes pleasure in trying to intimidate the player - if the player triggers the Underdark option, he's snide about it as well.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Might still kill ya, mind.

session_synopses: Goblin is (gleefully) warning player about wandering down into the wolf pens.

Backup_04.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nozk
Backup_04.text: You outsiders never have ta guard the borin' posts.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

session_synopses.Backup_04: One of the guards at the door to the inner temple. He's been standing here for a while and shouldn've been switched out a while ago, but the change of guard never showed. He's very bored.
session_synopses.3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: 'Ere - you 'eard about wot happened on that last raid? Right so, some slob 'ad the drop on me...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eager to tell this story to anyone who'll listen

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: Then she falls flat on 'er face with an arrow in 'er back! That's the Absolute that is. Protectin' me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proud

session_synopses: Goblin telling a war-story in which he conflates blind luck with "the will of God".

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The eye's glassy black surface reflects your gaze.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: the 'eye' is large, magical and floating around watching you

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you gaze deeper, you feel a focus. An intent.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: this 'intent' is unnerving

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Reach out to the presence.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You feel a brief, lurching connection. The sensation of falling into your own image, endlessly.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: unnerving

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Confusion. Alarm. Then the presence withdraws - leaving a dull black mirror once more.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: urgency and mystery - the 'dull black mirror' is the surface of the crying eye

session_synopses: The scrying eye is a floating eye that acts as a sort of magical security camera. This one is hovering around the goblin camp spying on players and broadcasting back to Moonrise Towers. The presence watching is a drow at moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Roo
node_data.text: You a True Soul then, eh? The Absolute'll make me one too.

session_synopses: Goblin in camp, jealous that he isn't a true soul yet.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.text: Try to keep it down, boss. My head's killing me.
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: holding his head, wincing in pain from a hangover, trying to be respectful

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader.speaker: Player
Trader.text: Let me see what you have.

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: Get movin'. I got other customers.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Don't matter who he was. He ain't nothin' but a stain now.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: referring to a dead adventurer at his feet - matter of fact

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Jus' like you'll be if you don't clear off.

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Hey, can I see yer brand? The priestess gave me one, and I think she did it wrong.
Goblin007.context: NodeContext: He has been branded (by choice) and his arm is badly burned. He's too drunk to care too much though

Goblin007.speaker: Player
Goblin007.text: I don't have a brand. Yet.

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Well, go get one inside, then! But 'ave a drink first. It stings sumfin' proper.

Goblin001.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001.text: This ale tastes like hobgoblin spit. Who's been pukin' in the barrel?

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: D'ya fancy a hunk of dwarf meat, under-dweller? He ain't ready yet.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit - 'under-dweller' refers to the fact the player is a duergar, a dark dwarf

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001.text: Where did you find a dwarf?

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: He found us! Dunno wot he was doin' 'ere or where he came from.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: responding to player asking about the dead dwarf he's cooking

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: Lads inside are tryin' to get answers out of one of his mates.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: 'tryin' to get answers' means 'torturing'. He's enjoying telling us this.

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001.text: I can get you answers. Where's the prisoner?

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: Enjoy pokin' holes in people do ya?
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: amused, we just told him we're willing to help his friends torture somebody

Bugbear_Wanderer.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer.text: You find the ones who poisoned that beer, you bring 'em to me. I'll take their heads for free.

Bugbear_Wanderer.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer.text: Poisonin' the only good thing in this dump...
Bugbear_Wanderer.context: NodeContext: grumbled, not really to the player.

Goblin003.speaker: Brawler Rot
Goblin003.text: Wass holdin' up the game? Chicken ain't dead is it?

GoblinKid002.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002.text: Stupid, dead bastard. Give him a good kickin' - he deserves it!
GoblinKid002.context: NodeContext: this kid is standing over - and insulting - the corpse of a dead adventurer, and gives it a kick as he speaks to us

GoblinKid002.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002.text: Yeah! Right in the gnashers! You're all right.
GoblinKid002.context: NodeContext: reacting to players kicking a corpse - cheering, and then being friendly

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin007: A somewhat zealous goblin eager to tell us about the mark that the Absolute's followers have branded onto their flesh
session_synopses.Goblin001: A goblin drinking merrily at a party - tipsy.
session_synopses.DwarfOperator001: This goblin is operating a spit, cooking a dead dwarf. He's in a festive area, where his friends are celebrating a recent raid. The dwarf was captured when attempting to steal something from the goblin camp, and he'll tell us a little about that.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Wanderer: A very grumpy bugbear guard who'd rather be sleeping.
session_synopses.Goblin003: This goblin is a spectator - initially of a bard singing a song in which he's not partcularly interested, and later of a game of chicken chase
session_synopses.GoblinKid002: An unpleasant goblin kid, standing over and insulting the corpse of a dead adventurer. The adventurer killed his parents, but if players offer sympathy he'll mock them.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Bolt
node_data.text: I'd do what he says. Ain't wanna make the boss any madder 'n he already is.

session_synopses: Standard goblin guard. Grouchy.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe. She actually wants to kiss his feet as well, but doesn't want to let it show yet.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: What was it like? Just... just curious.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe and a little jealous. She wants him to kiss her feet/to kiss his feet as well.

Friend1.speaker: Player
Friend1.text: My gorge is rising just thinking about it.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: Yes, yes that's... what you'd think, innit?
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She actually doesn't think so, but she's ashamed to admit it. She also expected you to give her a different answer.

session_synopses.Friend1: Goblin standing next to Crusher. She's got a crush on him.

SpottedHostilePlayer.text: You! I remember you from the forest. You should never have come here.
SpottedHostilePlayer.context: NodeContext: They are hostile toward you and will fight you after htis line.

session_synopses.SpottedHostilePlayer: Priests of Conquering God can become hostile in FOR. If player leaves combat, priests still apear at Goblin Camp. This dialog happens if they spot a hostile player just to show player the reason why the whole camp suddenly becomes hostile.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Huk
node_data.text: Hmph.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He waves you off, while he keeps looking at the goblin boss.

session_synopses: This goblin is watching his boss in awe and doesn't want to be sisturbed. When he speaks, he does so in hushed tones.

Goblet.speaker: Lookout Grush
Goblet.text: I'm watchin' ya. Spike promised that any meat that falls off is mine.
Goblet.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's standing a few paces away from the prisoner.NodeContext: Mean.

session_synopses.Spike_Dead: Speak with dead: goblin torturer in camp. Non-Wyll version.
session_synopses.Goblet: One of the guards standing next to the torture. He's mean (and a cannibal).

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *The foul stench of slaughter turns suddenly sweet through the rat's nose.*

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *Blood-smell. Life-smell. Not like the great hollow below, which smells only of death.*

LocalRat_002.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_002.text: *A longing for small spaces, stone walls hugging close. Confining. Comforting.*

LocalRat_002.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_002.text: *There is a light here, in the tight space beneath the floor. Secret things that shine.*

session_synopses.LocalRat_001: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp, feeding on whatever offal it finds. When we enter its mind we learn of a cavernous space below that it's constantly in fear of.
session_synopses.LocalRat_002: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp - we can learn of a puzzle hidden in the floor.

node_data.speaker: Tracker Azak
node_data.text: Leave me alone - ain't got time for chatter.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avoiding eye contact, afraidNodeContext: Avoiding eye contact, afraid - a slave speaking to a master

session_synopses: A goblin who is afraid of drow, having been a former slave

Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom.text: |I still have info to exctract from prisoner. Don't do anything funny!|

session_synopses.SlowDown_NoGoblins: The player senses a windmill's rotation slow or halt entirely after they apply a brake. If present, some goblins go to investigate the disturbance.

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: Well, lookie here. Seems like you know your way around the course.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: Reassessing you - you've just proven yourself to be quite good at the game and she's patronising you

Commentator.speaker: Player
Commentator.text: Your rules didn't say anything about fire.

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: Well who ever heard o' chicken chase without fire? We're not bloody amateurs.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: As if you're just being stupid now. Scornful - you can't play chicken chase without fire, keep up.

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: Oof. Hard luck, mate. Told you it weren't as easy as it looked.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: As if announcing a goal in a sporting event

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: That's the spirit! Now show me the coin.
Commentator.context: InternalNodeContext: Checking the bet because jumping to the betting nodes which can be shown to the players during the game alsoNodeContext: Loud, encouraging - but more eager to see your money.

Commentator.speaker: Player
Commentator.text: On second thought, I'm done playing.

session_synopses.Commentator: This goblin is a commentator on the much-loved goblin sport of chicken-chasing, which involves chasing a chicken (or later, a much larger owlbear) through a set of posts to score a 'chicken-strike'. She's fanatically devoted to the sport, and expects the same dedication from everyone. She'll invite the player to take part, but only if you make a bet.

Penance.speaker: Abdirak
Penance.text: The pain you suffer will cleanse you - do not fight it.
Penance.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon in hand (it will be either a dagger, a scourge, or a handaxe). Perhaps by his side as he takes a breathe between strikes to speak to the player. NodeContext: First time stirking the player. Excited and joyous - think a preacher building up to a full 'the lord will save us' act in a church.

Penance.speaker: Player
Penance.context: InternalNodeContext: When the event flag CancelPenance is set, Osiris takes care of clearing more flags and resetting the penance

Battlestation.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation.text: My penitent child, the goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: Player has finished penance. Speaking to player as if speaking to a loved one.

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.text: Loviatar herself found your performance inspiring and wishes to bless you.
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: Voice intimate and filled with admiration. His goddess has chosen to bless the player - a sacred gift.

session_synopses.Penance: This occurs as Abdirak is beating the player. Breathless with excitement. Reveling in the act of penance - think preacher in 'god will save us, save us ALL!' mode as he, well, beats the crap out of the player. All of his reactions should be manic, joyous and vaguely sexual. Player is in front of him, facing a wall as he raises his weapon and beats the player. The weapon will be either a dagger, handaxe or a scourge.
session_synopses.Battlestation: The goblins are fighting. He's going to leave, He loves pain - not death.
session_synopses.PostPenance: |Abdirak fully completed his penance with a player. It can't be tried again.|

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Brand looks good on you. Priestess reckons we should all be marked up before the next raid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: warm - sees us as allies

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Make sure whoever we're stickin' it to knows we're doin' it for the Absolute.
node_data.context: NodeContext: proud

session_synopses: Goblin is recently converted to new religion and eager to head out on a raid.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: I do not have time for interruptions from underlings.
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As she turns to you, her thoughts mingle with yours, a cold hand caressing your brain.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: the drow turns and looks at the player, studying themNodeContext: unnerved

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The chamber melts away to reveal a dark, endless nowhere. In it, you see a vision - the drow listens as a pale-eyed young woman whispers in her ear.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: mindmeld with Minthara as narrator describes vision of Minthara with Orin

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *One of those the voice spoke of. One of the Chosen. The vision fades away...*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: mindmeld with Minthara as narrator describes vision of Minthara with Orin

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: A True Soul? Praise be. Are you here to join my hunt?
node_data.context: NodeContext: appraising a potential ally

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Her heart is more generous than mine. Join my hunt, faerie. And obey me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: sinister - 'faerie' is a derogatory way of referring to the player's race (an elf)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Join you? I'm here to kill you.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: You would dare...? Guards - to me!
node_data.context: NodeContext: player has threatened her - shocked by their bravery

session_synopses: The drow commander is a True Soul, sent to the goblin camp in order to instil some discipline in the goblins and lead their raids. She's already had one success - at the tavern - but the adventurers who infiltrated the goblin camp are her next targets. The Absolute believes they have something of value, and she must reclaim it. The players can tell her that the adventurers fled to the grove in which case she'll see the players as perfect candidates to help her infiltrate the place, having mistaken them for True Souls.

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Ha! Look at where the Absolute's love got 'em. Dead!
Saved.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin was saved from the cage and his attackers are dealt with.NodeContext: happy to see lots of dead heretics

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Thanks for breakin' me out. Gonna find me a new tribe. One that appreciates the old ways.

session_synopses.Saved: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage. He thanks players after they save him.

Goblin_002.speaker: Sharp-Eye Crub
Goblin_002.text: You're either with the Absolute or against her. Ain't no in-between.

session_synopses.Goblin_002: One goblin announced the blade of frontiers has no change against the Absolute!

Caster_01.speaker: Erna
Caster_01.text: You don't want to go in there. Really.
Caster_01.context: NodeContext: Flat, more serious. The previous warning was an attempt to be friendly, but we're pushing our luck now and the humour's gone.

session_synopses.Caster_01: This mercenary is guarding the entrance to a supply of incredibly rare and explosive material. She's trying to strike a more reasonable tone than the other guard we speak to.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: Yes, my desire. Closer, my sweet!
Spiders.context: NodeContext: Excited, drooling with desire to eat us.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: I will wrap you, and bind you, and bite you, and eat you.
Spiders.context: NodeContext: Excited, almost to herself, thinking about how she'll eat us

Spiders.speaker: Player
Spiders.text: You should eat a goblin instead. They're delicious.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: Delicious - I do not know. But cruel and sharp - yes. Bindable and wrappable and biteable - yes.
Spiders.context: NodeContext: delighted, preparing to escape and feast on goblins who have held it captive

Adventurer.speaker: Smythin
Adventurer.text: Thanks. I thought I was done for.

session_synopses.Spiders: Non-critpath. Two giant spiders trap the player. The one that shoots the web is female. Her companion is her brother.  The player has a chance to convince the spiders they are friendly, setting the spiders loose on the goblins in the camp above.
session_synopses.Adventurer: an adventurer who survived being thrown into the goblins' spider pit

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: ... an' the gnoll gnawed 'er arm clean off. So much for the Flamin' Fist, eh?
Backup002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to other goblins at table.

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: The Fist? Merc pigs from Baldur's Gate. Good for one thing: feedin' to worgs.

Guard002.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Neutral, not particularly friendly but not hostile

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: Greeting node inquiring - is the player part of her clan?

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She gives player a drink (item goes into inventory).NodeContext: Elated. Player has confirmed they're from the same clan. She gives player a drink (item goes into inventory).

AlarmSystem.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem.text: *A great, taut drum sits before you. One strike would likely ring for miles, alerting goblin reinforcements.*

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.Backup002: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Telling a story of the inn ransacking. Really into violence :)
session_synopses.TopCliffWarning: Player is climbing a cliff they shouldn't be and is spotted by a goblin guard.
session_synopses.Guard002: One of several goblin guards protecting a checkpoint. Grunt type who thinks he's more important than he is. If you humiliate yourself before him, he's gleeful in your misery.
session_synopses.Backup001: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. This goblin is a bit touched in the head and wonders whether you're a member of her tribe. She's a woman even though some of the notes are male.
session_synopses.AlarmSystem: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialog.text: Mistress! It's me, yer loyal servant, Sazza. I'm back - an' I brought a friend.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ThreeWayDialog.text: How thoughtful. And where did you find this friend?

session_synopses.ThreeWayDialog:
The players approach the drow commander at the goblin camp, escorted by a goblin who they rescued from a nearby druid grove. The drow is seeking that grove and upon learning its location from the goblin will prepare to raid it, demanding that the player help.

If the goblin recognises that the player is a True Soul - a figure of authority - her life will be spared. If she does not recognise this, the drow will execute her unless the player intervenes on her behalf.

NoticedPoisoning.text: Hey! You tryin' to slip us somethin'?

NoticedPoisoning.speaker: Narrator
NoticedPoisoning.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.NoticedPoisoning: A nearby goblin saw the player poison the vat of beer and confronts them.

Attack_AssaultCustom.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Attack_AssaultCustom.text: You defile the Absolute's name. Boys!

session_synopses.Attack_AssaultCustom: Goblin king sees player commit a crime and initiates attack.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: You there! A friendly face. You haven't the looks of one of these cultists about you, no sir!

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: I'm in no hurry to take my turn on that spit out front. Perhaps you'd be so kind as to unlock this cage?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: How did you end up in this place?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Curiosity, my friend. It didn't benefit the cat, but it's the foundation of my career.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Though I admit I've hit something of an impasse. Please - unlock my cell?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: I'll think about it. No promises.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: I don't need a promise, my friend. Only an honest attempt. Please - do consider it!

session_synopses.Volo_InCage: Volo has been caught by the goblins and imprisoned. He has an invisbility potion he can use to escape once he's out of the cage, but he needs the player's help. He's a combination of desperate for help and his usal, confident self.

Branding.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding.text: Ready to figure out what's goin' on with those shadows in your head?

session_synopses.Branding:
The sadistic goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute.

 She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's cruel and has a sense of superiority over her own kind. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.speaker: Narrator
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.text: *The goblin appears annoyed. It might be best to leave the prisoner alone.*
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.context: InternalNodeContext: Assault - gobs don't know about Den

session_synopses.TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom: Crime dialogue when a random goblin sees you hurting or killing Liam.

session_synopses.CINE_ClimbDown: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using a ladder to get from the Goblin Camp to the Underdark

node_data.speaker: Rozzak
node_data.text: If you're here to help with the raid, talk to her ladyship. She's in charge.
node_data.context: NodeContext: deferential to 'her ladyship'. Dismissive toward us

session_synopses: Impatient goblin. Planning a raid with a drow, and he's deferring to her.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Nrog
node_data.text: Priestess burned ya, then? Thought I smelled somethin' tasty cookin'.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sniffs player before delivering line.NodeContext: Sniffs at player again before delivering line. Tone is mocking but friendly.

session_synopses: This goblin is standing guard inside temple - he's a little more relaxed than his zealous companion. Offers 'beginners' advice to player. As hostile as any other goblin if you try to pass without his superior's permission.

node_data.speaker: Brawler Gurd
node_data.text: Oh, bugger off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: "gotta stick to my work" delivered deferentially, 'bugger off' dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin preparing for a raid, at a distance from the party going on elsewhere in the camp. He's trying to keep his head down, getting on with his work.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: You look like you could kick the arse of half the scrubs in here. Bunch of drunken layabouts.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Appraising of player.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: Not me though. I'm as hard as they come, an' I'm itchin' for another fight.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proud.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Speaking of another fight - what's the next raid going to target?

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: Drow's studyin' the war map, tryin' to figure it out.
node_data.context: NodeContext: matter of fact

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: You should talk to her... get the killin' started quicker.
node_data.context: NodeContext: happy...malicious on final phrase

session_synopses: Sober goblin, tough, itching for a fight.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
node_data.text: Don't let our little pet scare ya, mate. Bloody bugbear couldn't break those bars.

session_synopses: Goblin is telling player of the captive they've placed in the wolf pens.

node_data.speaker: Narvass
node_data.text: Silence. You'll interrupt the ritual.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's watching a ritual, trying not to disturb it.NodeContext: stern, but not too loud - he doesn't want to interrupt the ritual himself.

session_synopses: Watching the goblin king perform the Speak with Dead spell.

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.context: NodeContext: Proud that the bear died

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The bear is tucked away in a corner, trying to make himself small.InternalNodeContext: default - not met, didn't speak about leaving the captiveNodeContext: excited/in awe because he made a bear squeal.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: Giggle before the line. She's excited because the woman makes noises when they throw stones at her.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: stern - she's trying to turn this torture into a learning experience for the kids.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: A little humph of excertion while Three throws the stone.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Again! Again! Make it squeal again!

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Sharper stones might cut through all that fur.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: Triumphant hump of excertion

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear whimpers as the stone hits him and looks at us directly, as if begging us to help it.

Beastmaster002.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002.text: Ever tried cuttin' up an elf? All skin an' bones, the rangy gits. My arm's gonna be sore tomorrow.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.text: Get rid of them. Release me.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speak with animals lineInternalNodeContext: Speak with animals lineNodeContext: Speak with animals line

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: 'Ere to see the bear? Just follow the noise. Worgs 'ave been goin' crazy for it.
Beastmaster001.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful - worgs are not acting their usual selves.

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: Just hope these scraps will satisfy the bunch when they're in this state.

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionNodeContext: Speak with Animals line

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionInternalNodeContext: Bear allied with player against goblins.

Worg_002.speaker: Tale
Worg_002.text: Fur. Can't you smell the fur? Fur and meat. Lots of MEAT!

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.GroupDialogWithBear: Player finds a group of goblin kids throwing stones at a bear, spurred on by their mother. The bear is the arch druid Halsin, in bear form. He won't make this apparent to the player, even if they have Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Beastmaster002: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage: A  bear who is imprisoned in the goblin camp. This bear is in fact the arch druid Halsin, though he doesn't reveal this to us until after he's out of his cage, even if we use Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Beastmaster001: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.AfterRelease_Bear: After the goblins release the bear its asks you if you will help him to kill them.
session_synopses.Worg_002: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transformed into a bear.

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *This mighty drum is powerful enough to be heard for miles. You need only strike it.*

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *Chaos ignites in the ruins around you. Goblins howl and spit, clawing for their weapons.*
WarDrum.context: InternalNodeContext: The player might play the drum again when the Backup and Checkpoint goblins are talking or dancing

session_synopses.WarDrum: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.

VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.text: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experience a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.
VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experience a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.

VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.text: Hear my voice. Obey my command.
VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.context: CinematicNodeContext: Characters look on the verge of collapsing. NodeContext: Faint, yet authoritative. The voice of a omnipotent, yet unseen being.

VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.speaker: Narrator
VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.text: *The voice is irresistible. Every word is drenched with a power and authority that you do not understand, but cannot deny.*
VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.context: InternalNodeContext: The player hasn't used their illithid powers

session_synopses.VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox: The party hears the voice of the Absolute, faint, in their minds.Shadowheart takes out the infernal puzzle box, it glows brighter and brighter, and then the voice stops. Player avatar questions Shadowheart about the box. If the player is not aware of Shadowheart being a Shar worshipper, then they can discover this here, if she tells them about the artefact.

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: How you doing, pal? Looking for some odds and ends? I've scavenged all sorts.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly, like a cheeky bloke at a market selling stolen goods

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: Didn't expect to see you grubbing around here in the muck and the leftovers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I thought there might be something useful here.

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: There is. Lots. But I've got scavenger's rights, so it's all mine, unless you're willing to trade for it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

session_synopses: After Goblin Hunt Celebration night and persuading Minthara to spare their lives, player can observe Goblin camp being empty with only one goblin trader looting what's rest in the Festivities area.This is that goblin's dialog.

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: There are many memories I wish I could erase from my mind - the stench of this place is chief among them.

session_synopses.CINE_Statue_02: Cinematic arena dialog to destroy a statue.

session_synopses.AD_DarkUrge: Dark Urge approaches the Roasting Dwarf

AD_Guard_004_TakingTurn_Combat.speaker: Tracker Rindle
AD_Guard_004_TakingTurn_Combat.context: NodeContext: Vicously, about to attack. Bit of a taunt

AD_Goblin_001_Combat.speaker: Warrior Sul
AD_Goblin_001_Combat.text: Bet them guts are nice and juicy!

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: The druid Halsin is in here somewhere.

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: Let's hope we find him in one piece.

session_synopses.PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp: Thematically, this VB is a conversation about the goblin camp and how difficult it might be to find the druid there. Player will be aware that he's being held captive somewhere in the camp and can see the goblins's strength.This occurs over walking into a trigger, so lines between speaker 1 and speaker 2 can be fairly opinionated.

FirstThanks.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FirstThanks.text: Come. I'm afraid proper thanks must wait.

session_synopses.AD_Trapped: Desire calls out to anyone that can listen, as she is trapped in a room in a burning building.
session_synopses.FirstThanks: You speak with Desire after freeing her but before she reaches safety and engages the flaming fist

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: What did you have to come creeping in for? Sorry - we'll make this quick.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: No prisoners! No mercy! Take them!

Zhent07.speaker: Vol
Zhent07.text: Didn't I tell you to move along?

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: Well, won't get that letter sent this side of the Underdark.

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'Dear mother - saw my first gibbering mouther, and sorry I ever compared you.'

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'At least the mouther had to stop for breath.'

AD_InvestigationCheck.speaker: Player
AD_InvestigationCheck.text: There's a breeze down here. Wonder where it's coming from.

Zhent05_AD_Idle.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle.text: Thought I was paid to crack heads, not stack bloody boxes.

Zhent02_AD_Idle.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Idle.text: Lamps, lads - sealed lamps! Don't want open flames where we're going.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: That's far enough. What's your business down here? Answer honestly, and maybe we'll kill you clean.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Neutral but firm - she's not remotely afraid of us but

Zhent02_Stage1.text: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1.text: I don't want trouble - I just want to trade.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: Trade with what? Your life was ours the moment you walked in here.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - our life is in her hands, and she's stating it as a simple matter of fact.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: But... maybe I'll let you buy it back. I have a job needs doing.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Considering us - normally she'd kill us but we just tried to talk our way into her base, and she could use skills like that.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: We've disarmed the traps. Come down.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: An order, not a request - we're entirely in her power as far as she's concerned.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: Wanna pick out the true Zhent? Tell 'em they're going down into the Underdark.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: While everyone else is bawling, they'll be the ones asking about hazard pay.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: What - come to kill me yourself? You might as well.
DoubtingArtist.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, already met the playerNodeContext: Intense, eager - waiting for us to tell him he's free

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist.text: Relax - I'll speak to your captors.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: Now I don't mean to hurry you - but if you could hurry, I'd be most obliged.

Zhent01.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01.text: You're a friend of the family now. Just as well I didn't blow you up, eh?
Zhent01.context: NodeContext: Chummy - he was ready to kill you just a few moments before but knows you're an ally now.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Olly
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: I'm sick of hiding down in the dark. This ain't why I joined the Zahent!
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if Olly is alive and all speakers are available.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: It's pronounced 'Zent', lad. The H is silent.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Olly
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: I don't care. I want out of this damn cave.

Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: A little bit of this will turn your blood to treacle.
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.text: Don't just paint faces. People got other parts, too.

VB_Entrance.speaker: Player
VB_Entrance.text: A cave beneath the tavern. I wonder how deep it runs...

Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: Let's see how you like a little rot.
