CampIntro.text: Now go on, sergeant's above. Can't miss her - just follow the screams.

session_synopses.CampIntro: Another duergar greets you on the other side of the lake after sailingthere with captain Greymon.Both duergar are surly, but Morghal in particular. She is suspicious of Absolutists, but happy to take their coin. She should be gruff, and absolutely not listless. She tells you that Nere is trapped above.

AD_NoAnswerFromGod.speaker: Narrator
AD_NoAnswerFromGod.text: *There is no answer from the presence.*

AD_BOOOALAppears.speaker: BOOOAL
AD_BOOOALAppears.text: CUT YOU BREAK YOU TASTE YOU!

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: You've slain the pretender! We knew in our hearts the god BOOOAL was false.
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: In awe of you, rushing to affirm his faith - and absolutely means it

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: But you - we see you. We know you by your true name... MAHKLOOMPAH!
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: Kuo-Toa give overwrought, nonsensical names to their gods. Air of great ceremony as he bestows one on you

session_synopses.AD_NoAnswerFromGod: The player has clicked an altar from which a godly presence spoke previously.
session_synopses.AD_BOOOALAppears: This line plays when we force a creature to reveal itself by overwhelming it with bloodlust
session_synopses.HighPriest: The Zealot is a Kuo Toa obsessed with his new god - you. You've slain the 'pretender' he was just as dedicated to only moments before, and he's transferred all that zealotry to you.Mahkloompah = ma-KLOOM-pa.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You stare into the eye. Your reflection stares back.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The longer you stare, the more uneasy you feel. There is a presence. You are seen.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye more intensely

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack the eye.

session_synopses: Player clicks on the scrying eye patrolling in Grymdark. Passing an Insight check lets you look back into the presence watching you (one of the scryers at Moonrise Towers). This dialogue uses the same template as the dialogue with the scrying eye in the goblin camp.

node_data.speaker: Mossy Myconid
node_data.text: ((*no peace*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

Squad_Sniper.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper.text: You'll want to speak with Gekh.

GCB_ForbiddenRaft.speaker: Novice Garmor
GCB_ForbiddenRaft.text: Speak for yourself - I've got plenty of harm intended.

Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.text: Die, so your carcass can rise!

Squad_Wizard.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Wizard.text: You'll want to speak to Gekh. He's in charge.
Squad_Wizard.context: NodeContext: Respectful towards a drow player.

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

session_synopses.Squad_Sniper: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.
session_synopses.GCB_ForbiddenRaft: A henchman of Gekh Coal, a duergar follower of the Absolute, stops the player when he sees them interacting with a raft that'll let them progress across a lake and beyond his reach. If they haven't yet fulfilled their promise to help him, he warns them to leave the raft alone.
session_synopses.Squad_Wizard: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.
session_synopses.DeadDuergar_Dead: The corpse of a duergar follower of the Absolute, who was part of a group sent to hunt down an escaped deep gnome slave in the Underdark. This duergar died after encountering some myconids - sentient fungal creatures with telepathic powers.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Tell Laridda I'm dead. It's the best way.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

session_synopses.HiddenGnome: Philomeen is ready to die for her cause. She has run from the duergar with explosives and when the player arrives, she assumes they are a true soul and would sooner blow herself up than let the player take her to Moonrise.If you reach the end of her dialogue, she'll leave once you get far enough away.
session_synopses.PAD: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

session_synopses.MyconidDrow_Dead: Xargrim is one of three drow wizards who was looking for the Adamantine Forge. Friends turned rivals, these wizards each compete to find the forge, trying to steal the knowledge of the others as they go. Xargrim ambushed one of his fellows and set a spectator on him, but the strain of the ritual killed him.

session_synopses.01: Drow hang from the bridge. PAD as we see them - ‚ÄúDuergar rarely stand up to drow so boldly.‚ÄùOne duergar is here, patrolling with a crossbow. He tells us he‚Äôs keeping watch over the lake - these drow were trying to infiltrate the settlement, and more may come.

session_synopses.Dead: An SwD dialog for the Duergar Leader. She could be dead either because of player, Nere (her superior) or gnomes.

003.speaker: Petrified Drow
003.text: Dhourn... dead. I need to think.
003.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said soiftly to himself, slightly panicked because his wizard friend diedNodeContext: Door-n

003.speaker: Player
003.text: What were you thinking, fighting a spectator?

003.speaker: Petrified Drow
003.text: Came with the wizard - Dhourn. He was looking for treasure and promised a cut. Or so he said.

003.speaker: Petrified Drow
003.text: A rival of his popped out of nowhere. 'Xargrim'... something like that. Unpleasant fellow.

003.speaker: Petrified Drow
003.text: They had words. Nasty ones. Xargrim summoned the spectator. Never saw one like that - petrified us all.

session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.Dead_Wizard: SwD with Dhourn (leader of the petrified Drow).You can learn from this dialog about:- Forge- Memory Crystal and Activation Word for it;- Xagrism (one of his frenemies)
session_synopses.003: This drow was petrified by a spectator.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.Leave after a long rest.

PAD_FoundRune.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRune.text: This is a Harper rune. There must be a stockpile nearby.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundRune: Party discovers a strange marking. They may or may not recognise it as a Harper symbol.
session_synopses.PAD_RecogniseWatchword: The Sharran Inquisitor's diary documents the Harper Spy's interrogation. The spy is quoted reciting a Harper Watchword during the interrogation. Players that pass a History Check will recognise the watchword, and understand that the Light spell is required to bypass the spy's trap

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*cleanse the Rot*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The gnome was under the protection of the myconid circle. They will see you answer for violating it.*

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: If you cared so much, you'd have cured her already.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The circle's music slows. You recognise the melody as one of shame and mourning.*

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The myconids will raise her husk. Life born from death - as penance.*

session_synopses.InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder: Myconid responses to seeing Thulla - the injured gnome - being killed through the dialog.

SurvivalCheck_PAD.speaker: Player
SurvivalCheck_PAD.text: Bloodied tracks - quite small, too. A gnome found some trouble here.

session_synopses.SurvivalCheck_PAD: The player identifies Thulla's tracks to be that of an escaping gnome if they pass a survival check

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.

session_synopses.AdamantineGolemSpawn: After a party member opens the valve that pours lava out of on the forging platform, a golem climbs out of the pipes, attacking them.Note: The valve can be activated by (ranged) attacks and spells, so party member positioning is not guaranteed.Note 2: Party members who are not players can activate the valve.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*

Looted_Solo.speaker: Player
Looted_Solo.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *You recognise the symbol of your Lady. You know these uniforms.*
Looted_Solo.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player goes into a crouch, looks over the bodies

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, an honorary order within the priesthood of Shar.*

session_synopses.Looted_Solo: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

DuergarBoatAtCave.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat sits in the water

DuergarBoatAtCave.text: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.

RaftEvent.speaker: Player
RaftEvent.text: Reach out to the duergar's parasite.

RaftEvent.speaker: Narrator
RaftEvent.text: *Your parasite stirs briefly, then goes still. The duergar is not infected.*
RaftEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player touches their head briefly, but there is no mind meld.

DuergarBoatAtCamp.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: *The boat floats in the murky waters.*
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat floating in the water

DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.

session_synopses.CINE_RaftApproaching: We see a raft with duergar approaching our raft.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCave: Dialogue when clicking on boat in cave to reach Grymforge. Player can stay or cross. This dialogue only appears once player has already been to Grymforge.
session_synopses.RaftEvent: The players use a boat to reach the duergar camp. In the middle of the lake, they are confronted by a group of duergar on a raft. Being Drow/Duergar changes the tone of the conversation and makes the persuasion event easier. Having the mark of the Absolute can also make the persuasion event easier.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCamp: Dialogue when clciking boat in Grymforge to reach the other side of the lake. Player can cross or stay.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Nere's dead body.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.text: *The head breaks off cleanly from the drow's body.*
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show player's face as they finish decapitation, stow knife. Raise head to inspect it.

session_synopses.NereHeadLoot: After the drow Nere dies, the players have the option to cut off his head if they are on a Myconid Revenge quest. If they fail the Strength check, the player makes a mess of it and the party gets splattered.

session_synopses.BottomFairyRingActivationCinematic: Cinematic dialog. Shows the activation process for a Fairy Ring.Before the dialogue: the player approaches an active (has vfx) fariy mushroom ring. The dialogue starts. The camera shows the ring and the player (or only the ring) and then rotats and looks down, at another fairy mushroom ring which is inactive, it has no vfx. The VFX activates for the bottom ring, emphasizing activation. End of the cinematic.

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: How peculiar. Smooth face, cobbled edges. They're a sign - they must be.
01.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stonemason Kith facing away from player, looking at rubble.

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: A sundweller in these parts? Look here, my top-side friend - I need fresh eyes. And I doubt I'll find fresher.
01.context: CinematicNodeContext: The stonemason turns to you and addresses you directly.

01.speaker: Player
01.text: Fine. What should I be looking at?

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: The rock. The rubble. All of it, if I may be so bold.

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: Take a look. Tell me what you see. And be thorough.

01.speaker: Player
01.text: Assess the statue for technique and composition.

01.speaker: Narrator
01.text: *The statue's meandering curves and golden edges stand out against the weathered masonry behind it.*

01.speaker: Narrator
01.text: *Two styles, two eras. The statue was carved from newer stone and erected by late-comers to this ancient fortress.*

session_synopses.01: Duergar looking at stonework. Gruff sounding but surprisingly sophisticated. He asks you to examine the stonework and responds with his interpretation based on what you tell him

LootingCorpse.speaker: Narrator
LootingCorpse.text: *Deep gnomes - killed under the yoke of slavers.*
LootingCorpse.context: CinematicNodeContext: Panning over small field of dead bodies.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Player
LootingCorpse.text: I will take the lives of those who took yours.

session_synopses.LootingCorpse: Player having a contemplative moment while observing the corpses of dead gnomes.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Fah. Thought I'd have to breathe my last in Nere's stink.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful. Breathless.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: I'm grateful, don't mistake me, but... why help us? You're one of them, aren't you?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Guarded, sizing the player up - he thinks we're one of the cultists

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Are you always so suspicious of those who save you?

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: I try not to need saving. Hasn't much worked out, as you can see.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Self-deprecating

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: You did just lift a mountain from our heads, so... good enough for me, I reckon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nodding, accepting - not going to look a gift horse in the mouth

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Here - the Ironhand Gnomes honour their debts. With Wulbren gone, that falls to me.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard 'handing reward' animation.NodeContext: Drawing himself up to perform a necessary obligation - doesn't see himself as leadership material but accepts the responsibility

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Make it quick! We need to find Wulbren - now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Keep the coin. It seems like you'll need it.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: No. Debt's a stone 'round your neck, and we Ironhands like to walk tall. We'll be fine.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Gently firm - too proud not to give you a reward

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: It's Wulbren I'm worried for. He was sent on to Moonrise Towers.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We were just slave-hands to the cult, but not Wulbren. He... knows things. Things they want to know too.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hesitant to say exactly what Wulbren knows

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: What has he gotten himself mixed up in now...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Before you ask, no - I'm not going to stage a rescue.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Aye. Nor us, I'm afraid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: shrugging, a little defeated. This line trails off into another 'Much as I want to march after Wulbren myself... we can't.'

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We have our own freedom to look to, I'm afraid. We'll take our chance when it arises, then back to the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: His people are still enslaved - he needs to be pragmatic.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Wulbren knew the risks when he came in search of runepowder. We all did.

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: Thanks again for offing that drow. Only made it here 'cause of you. But I can't stop thinking about the rest of us...

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: ... stuck in Moonrise with a bunch of sadists. Poor bastards.

session_synopses: The gnome leader's main dialogue. He thanks you for saving them, and tells you what brought his people to the Underdark to begin with - an expedition led by their charismatic leader Wulbren, to find a forgotten gnomish explosive of awesome power - runepowder.
session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome foreman on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Mentions the other gnomes being kept at moonrise towers.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Incredible. Every rock, every jewel tells a story.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The most interesting secrets are alway lurking just under the surface.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can talk to Stonemason Kith to obtain some info on the city. The following VB is a reaction to the knowledge acquired in that dialog. For specifics, see UND_DuergarRebelMason_01.This will be anchored on the character who left the dialog but this is mostly reacting to an info dump, so all characters can be opinionated.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The wall is riddled with holes. A suffocating stench of long-rotten meat wafts out.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera on holes in cavern wall

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Inspect the holes.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the odour - the foul scent of carrion crawlers, centipede-like aberrations that feast on the dead.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *At one time, these caverns must have been their banquet hall. The creatures are either long gone, or waiting patiently in the darkness.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

session_synopses: The player encounters a wall riddled with small holes. A successful Survival check reveals that they were created by carrion crawlers. Small characters can reach in for loot.[Editor's note: try to think of some alternate ways of getting to the loot that don't involve choosing a gnome or halflng at the start of the game.][Scripter comment: we have spell Enlarge/Reduce planned, but I've also added Mage Hand support. Thanks!]

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*smooth-flesh. you are like them*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Duergar faces appear before you, one by one, each twisted by zealous cruelty.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Whispers. Moans. Disharmony. They drift through you like an unknown language.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Then, you see visions. Dark dwarves - duergar - chopping myconid remains with their axes.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*they broke our peace. they killed our young*))

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*we laid waste to many. you bring yet another. you bring us the Rot*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You see another vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision can be a simple linear pose to pose transition, portraying a single action

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I know the value of clan. Let me enter, so I may help yours.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but insistent.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*the Rot festers. duergar remain. lakeward*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The sovereign's song halts as it measures your might.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*I will reward. you cleanse the Rot. you destroy them*))

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*I sense your resolve. you will find duergar invaders near lake's edge. cleanse the Rot. destroy them*))

session_synopses: Main dialogue with creepy myconid sovereign. He wants you to kill some duergar that are left from when they attacked these mushroom creatures. Myconids are part of a "circle", kind of a hive mind. They speak in visions, with music - all telepathically. This should be otherworldly and slightly disturbing.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_01: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is taking his turn.

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Meerna... Nere killed her. She's - she's really gone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Shael vuk. Death is too good for him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

Saved.speaker: Welso
Saved.text: You've done so much, I hate asking for more. But you see more slavers? Burn them, skin them - make them hurt.

session_synopses: 'Welso's sister is trapped behind the rubble. He is panicked and scared - frantically trying to dig her out.
session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome worker on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Angry trills and tremors shake your skull - cries of anguish to its mycelic god.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

AtPier_01.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
AtPier_01.text: Got my eye on you, gnome.

session_synopses.AtPier_01: Duergar guarding the lakeside enterance to Ketheric City. Extra mean to deep gnomes.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Curious - that stone there's been pried loose.

session_synopses.PAD: The player notices a loose stone in the Duergar Camp.There is a hidden stash underneath.

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*the Circle is cleansed*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: The eye's clobbered - good work. Time to bust Nere out and shred him.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any ideas on how I might do that?

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Some days back, a slave gnome bolted with smokepowder. Handy stuff.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Bet her crew know more than they're letting on - see if you can get 'em to talk.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Once Nere's out, we'll pound him to powder and take our dues.

session_synopses: Leader of the Merceneries-to-be-mutineers. An elder mind-master with psionic sensitivity. You can follow up with him about the quest he gave you earlier.

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*we will find truth in dream*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

FollowUp.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
FollowUp.text: I'll be damned. Nere's gone and kicked it.

session_synopses.FollowUp: The player sided with Nere, but Nere died in combat. Thrinn announces her plan: to travel to Moonrise.

AD_BeckonPlayer.text: To me! I shall guide thee.

session_synopses.AD_BeckonPlayer: An amulet calls out to the player amid the rocks surrounded by lava in Grymforge.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *As you near the rubble, a fragmented voice clutches at your mind.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere starting to Mindmeld with the player

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.context: NodeContext: The original line is 'A True Soul? This is Nere. Tell those Imbiciles to hurry up! I am choking on poison.' Should be recorded normally, and effects should be added later to make it sound like the voice is fading in and out.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: Finally! You must clear... rubble. Filling... poison!

Mindmeld.speaker: Player
Mindmeld.text: Stay still. I'll do what I can.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: ...it quick or... head! Careful... mercs... on the edge...

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *The view through Nere's eyes is a blur. You only make out a bit of rubble and few moving figures.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: View from Nere's persepective Vision blurred and

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *You sense Nere's frustration, tinged with rage, as the connection fades.*

session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.
session_synopses.Mindmeld: A mindmeld with a True Soul through a brick wall - the connection is unstable because of this, and we do not hear everything the True Soul says.

Saved.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
Saved.text: Beldron said we'll head back to the city. But the others at Moonrise...

Saved.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
Saved.text: ... I can't bear to think of it.

session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome worker on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Laridda reflects on her missing friends, who are trapped in Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Bonna
node_data.text: Stay on yer own raft.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A slender drow blade impales the stone before you, keeping a silent vigil.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise your goddess' rite - a warrior's sacrifice. Only blood, freely given, will honour the fallen.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: This feels holy. Consider what the appropriate ritual might be.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *This blade was a warrior's sacrifice to Eilistraee. Blood can only be honoured with blood.*

session_synopses: Player discovers an improvised shrine to a dead drow warrior. There's a helmet resting on a sword that's been rammed into a stone. You can take the helmet, but you'll need to think of another way to get the sword free.

PAD_OnPlatform2.speaker: Player
PAD_OnPlatform2.text: Platform's covered in rust - must be older than bonedust.

session_synopses.PAD_OnPlatform2: The player steps on a rusted platform in Grymforge suspended by four chains. (An elevator, really.)

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

session_synopses.03: Pissed off duergar raider who is standing guard while the gnomes are digging up a collapsed tunnel. He is cursing his superior, saying they should just let him suffocate. The player can make use of this and threathen the duergar, saying they will tell the sergeant unless the duergar gives them money.

node_data.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
node_data.text: You ain't clan - you got no business here.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.NodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard. He is seated with the duergar elder most of the time.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *Alcohol - an odd vice for duergar, prone to triggering ancestral memories of brutal illithid enslavement.*

session_synopses.001: One-liner for duergar thug. He tells you to leave after speaking previously. You get a passive skill check that may relate how alcohol can cause bad memories for duergar, and then ask about it.

Hermit_Dead.speaker: Player
Hermit_Dead.text: You're confused. I would never harm something as beautiful as your beloved.

Hermit_Dead.speaker: Player
Hermit_Dead.text: How did you come to be here?

Hermit_Dead.speaker: Filro the Forgotten
Hermit_Dead.text: Chasing... mystery...  riddle... lie... the Adamantine Forge...

session_synopses.Hermit_Dead: Filro is one of three drow rivalry wizards in the Underdark who was looking for the Adamantine Forge, but his long research, loneliness and effects of the Sussur Tree  turned him mad. He lives with the hook horrors pack now.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Get Beldron out of there. Please.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've got explosive powder. That should open the way.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Incredible news. Drop it near the cave-in and set it alight!

session_synopses: One-liner dialog in Ketheric City for a gnome working on the cave-in.

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: Nicely handled. Those roth√© old sweethearts of yours or something?
Guard_002.context: NodeContext: The player did well, but duergar are rarely the complimentary types.

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: Pity I got to split you - that forge ain't for sharing.

Guard_002.speaker: Player
Guard_002.text: I calmed the roth√©, and now you want me dead?

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: You think we're letting you near that forge? You're as dumb as you are stupid.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Well look here - Nere's killer in the flesh. Make yourself useful, grab a cane and whip these drugnin' beasts into shape.
Guard_001.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: That rubble needs clearing, and my patience is hanging on by an arse whisker.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Shouldn't be trouble for a brute like you.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: Not enough caning for my tastes, but you got the job done.
CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.
RubbleAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: I almost feel bad about this.
RubbleAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.NodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack.text: You'll be feeling even worse in a moment.

session_synopses.Guard_002: One of the duergar guards near some deep rothe that're being used as hauling animals. Gruff and grim. Little patience and less empathy.Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.Guard_001: The taskmaster is another cruel duergar. He is whipping several pack animals to clear out some rubble, but his arm is tired and asks you to step in. You might discover they want the rubble cleared because a valuable forge can be found behind it. If you convince the beasts to break through, he attacks you because he doesn't want to share the wealth.
session_synopses.RubbleAttack: Duergar dialog that happens if the player attacks / destroys the wall  by fearful rothe.

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: I speak true, brothers! You know it in your hearts! You know it in your very souls!

FourWay.speaker: Lur Jox
FourWay.text: We need no 'Lolth' - no spider queen! Father Murmath is the head of clan Lur. He hatched us, raised us, feeds us!

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: What care we for his business here? He keeps us small. Keeps us contained. We should be with the Spider Queen - revered, adored!

FourWay.speaker: Player
FourWay.text: Turning on your head-of-clan, are you? I'm sure that'll end well.

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: We do not turn on Father Murmath. But we do outgrow him. The fate of clan Lur lies with the Spider Queen!

FourWay.speaker: Player
FourWay.text: I think your sister is right - among the Spider Queen's worshippers, you'll reach your true potential.

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: This and so much more. In Lolth's hairy embrace, all is possible.

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: HAHA! Yes! Now, brothers - our new dawn awaits!

Spider04.speaker: Lur Fu
Spider04.context: NodeContext: Quickly, rhythmically, like a chant

session_synopses.FourWay: In this dialogue, Lur Xanta is trying to convince the other 3 to leave with her to join the cult of Lolth.Player can help her convince them, or fail to do so and they will attack Lur Xanta for being disloyal.This dialogue has 2 outcomes:AGGRO: Lur Jox (or another spider) attacks Lur Xanta, killing her in one shot. (via gameplay - not cine)PEACEFUL: Lur Xanta convinces the other 3 to follow her into the Underdark-- they are leaving to somewhere new.Lur Xanta is fantatical and somewhat learned. The other 3 are a bit more simple.
session_synopses.Spider03: Followup with spiders after they kill their sister Xanta.
session_synopses.Spider02: Followup after the spiders have killed their sister Xanta for being disloyal.
session_synopses.Spider04: Followup dialogue with spider after they attack and kill Lur Xanta

PAD_InteractingWithOrb.speaker: Player
PAD_InteractingWithOrb.text: Something's off. Pure shadow - around me, inside me.

session_synopses.PAD_InteractingWithOrb: The character voicing feeling the presence of Shar when interacting with a Sharran artefact used to gain Darkvision.

session_synopses.AD: Player clicks on a sign in an abandoned village and receives its name: Moonhaven.

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog grows more aggressive

Dog.speaker: Narrator
Dog.text: *You see a name etched into the leather - 'Scratch'.*
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer look at the dog's neck (collar/tag doesn't necessarily have to be legible when combined with the narration)

session_synopses.Dead: Using Speak with Dead, we are able to talk to the spirit of Gomwick. He was killed by a band of gnolls, but managed to save his dog, Scratch, by forcing him to flee.
session_synopses.Dog:
In SwA, Scratch speaks like a human. He doesn't have any kind of dog-like affectation, nor is he stupid - he's well-spoken, even when he's saying 'dog' things. Throughout the dialogue, he's stoic but heartbroken, deluding himself into believing that his master is not dead.We come across the corpse of a man being protected by his loyal dog, Scratch.The dog refuses to let us near the dead man or his belongings, forcing us to try and win him over (or else just kill him). We can use Speak with Animals to get further insight into the dog's perspective.
 If we cast Speak with Dead upon the courier, we can learn the dog's name and use this as an additional way to win it over.

session_synopses.VB_DiscoverPriests: Player spots the wounded True Soul and his minions, is wary about what's going on.

AD_InvestigateMill.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill.text: Why's the spinnymajigger stopped? Get it moving again!
AD_InvestigateMill.context: NodeContext: Impatient and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive has stopped - their leader wants his cronies to investigate and get the windmill working again.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.text: Look's like the fun's over. C'mon, let's see who else we can snatch.
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

session_synopses.AD_InvestigateMill: Some goblins tormenting a gnome tied to a windmill are surprised when it stops rotating.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.
session_synopses.Dead: A speak with dead dialogue with a slain goblin, Fezzerk. As he's been just temporarily resurrrected from the afterlife, he speaks in slow, cryptic, fragmented phrases. From him, the player can gain a little insight into their hostage-taking activities. If Fezzerk recognises the player as his killer, he won't speak at all.

PAD_NoticeShrine.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeShrine.text: Over there - a shrine to Sel√ªne. By Moonmaiden's grace.
PAD_NoticeShrine.context: NodeContext: Shar worshipper: notices the Selune shrine and makes a disdainful comment. Selune worshippers: notices the shrine and reacts with reverence.

PAD_NoticeStashSeal.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeStashSeal.text: There's magic keeping this chest sealed; I can feel its aura.

PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite.context: NodeContext: Hushed awe. A good omen from their goddess.

session_synopses.PAD_NoticeShrine: The party comments on a little shrine they've discovered in a cavern - a grotto containing a statue and some prayers and offerings left by worshippers. Players may or may not recognise that the statue is the goddess Sel√ªne. Shadowheart, as well as certain cleric/paladin tags, will recognise the statue always.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticeStashSeal: Following a passive arcana check, the player comments that a chest discovered at a shrine has a spell cast over it, protecting its contents.
session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite: A Sel√ªne-worshipping player manages to unseal a magically locked chest after reading a prayer.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*

session_synopses.PAD_FindBook: PAD when you pick up 'The Necromancy of Thay' (DangerousBook_Tome.lsj). Character might have a sense that the book is evil or just be curious about what it might contain.
session_synopses.Tome: The player finds a book on necromancy - from one of the Red Wizards of Thay. Once read, the book will be bound to whoever tried to read it. Some origins will demand you let them read it, while others will want the book burned. If you read the book, you'll hear strange, distant whispers. The more you read, the stronger the voices will become, and the greater the chance that you'll be driven mad.

Goblin_01.speaker: Tracker Slice
Goblin_01.text: Just scraping up some pieces, majesty. Don't mind me.

AD_Boss.speaker: Tracker Slice
