AD_Boss.context: NodeContext: with disdain. isn't there anything interesting inthis shithole?

AD_Subordinates.speaker: Goblin Warrior
AD_Subordinates.text: And the others getting drunk off their choppers in camp.

AD_BossAndSubordinate.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_BossAndSubordinate.context: NodeContext: search the place, don't bother me

AD_BossAndSubordinate.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_BossAndSubordinate.text: And you got nothing to show for it but your own arse.

session_synopses.Goblin_01: A goblin is looting a house in Moonhaven. If interrupted, the goblin is grumpy to anyone but a drow.
session_synopses.AD_Boss: A goblin is scouting the village looking for loot, weapons, something of value
session_synopses.AD_Subordinates: Frustrated goblins searching a derelict building, finding little. They're bitter they can't be getting drunk in camp with the others.
session_synopses.AD_BossAndSubordinate: Goblins scouting an abandoned village-- boss is tired of his subordinates.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: Fezzerk does the talking here. Bother him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are rotating him around for their amusement.The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using the amulet of the Conquering God as a way to convince the goblins,  if they took it from the priests in the wilderness. GnomeGobllin2 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. He doesn't have much to say; either snarling threats or grovelling to those who intimidate him (drow, in this case).

node_data.speaker: Chock
node_data.text: Friend. No eat friend.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks.

session_synopses.PAD_SeluniteRitualScroll: Reflection on the Selunite Ritual scroll found in the Owlbear cave

VB_OwlBearPrints.speaker: Player
VB_OwlBearPrints.text: Looks like a beast came through here - a big one too.
VB_OwlBearPrints.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Spoken in reference to a large set of animal tracks they've spotted.

session_synopses.VB_OwlBearPrints: The player discovers a large set of animal tracks. They may be able to identify them as those of an owlbear.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: We're, eh, working hard for Absolute. Hope you spare a good word for us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Servile

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to windmill sail and are rotating him for their amusement. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possiblyby using their mind-influencing powers or otherwise convincing the goblins they're on the same side. GnomeGobllin3 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. She's abrupt and aggressive to most, though servile and meek if the player happens to be a drow.

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.context: NodeContext: Exclamation during combat, ordering lackeys

EmptyMindflayerPod.speaker: Narrator
EmptyMindflayerPod.text: *An empty mind flayer vessel. If its occupant survived, they're nowhere to be seen.*

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.text: The worms'll feast on your sorry carcass when I'm done with you!

session_synopses.EmptyMindflayerPod: Players encountered an empty pod in forest.

AD_DoorMarks.speaker: Narrator
AD_DoorMarks.text: *Names and heights have been carved into the wood over the years. The last two read 'Maggie Terrens' and 'Marcus Terrens'. Twins, perhaps.*

session_synopses.AD_DoorMarks: Markings on a door frame in an abandoned schoolhouse showing chidlren's growth over the years.

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Worg laughing at the unfoiruntae gnome getting tossed around.

LastCub.speaker: Narrator
LastCub.text: *The cub looks from you to his dead mother.*
LastCub.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cub looks from dead mother to the player, wailing.NodeContext: Narrator node!

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You feel the quake of its heavy footsteps before you see it: an owlbear, its beaked face looming out of the darkness.*

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: What's this? Something weak, something tender...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing up the player.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: Won't even have to chew you before I feed you to my son, softmeat.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're injured - there's still half a spear lodged in your head.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: It's a splinter. I've gutted bigger threats than you with worse.
node_data.context: NodeContext: She has a spear sticking out of her eye.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: The meat tastes better when it's afraid.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Just allow me to leave. I'm no threat to you or your cub.
False

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: You'll be even less of a threat when you're in pieces.

PAD_KilledByGoblins.speaker: Player
PAD_KilledByGoblins.text: Looks like the goblins found her.

VB_EggPickedUp.speaker: Player
VB_EggPickedUp.text: She'll tear me in two for touching her egg.
VB_EggPickedUp.context: NodeContext: Urgent. The player's taken an owlbear's unhatched egg while in combat with the owlbear mother (think a grizzly bear with a beak).

VB_EnterCave.speaker: Player
VB_EnterCave.text: That stench... dead owlbear prey, no doubt.
VB_EnterCave.context: NodeContext: Upon entering the den of a carnivorous beast. Rotting, half-eaten prey are strewn about. The player previously identified the beast as an owlbear.

CMB_Enrage.speaker: Owlbear
CMB_Enrage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Charges to attack.NodeContext: Horrified and enraged

session_synopses.LastCub: In SwA, this cub speaks in short bursts - he sounds staccato, vicious.The player has killed an owlbear - a large, predatory wild animal. The owlbear's cub remains however, and lingers by his dead mother. The player can decide whether to put the cub out of its misery, or else leave it. If the player has the speak with animals skill, they get some additional insight into the cub's anxiety. If the player lets the cub live, it will proceed to eat its mother - it's still a wild animal, after all.
session_synopses: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - the voice of a seasoned fighter, at home in a fight and used to winning. However, she knows she's injured and at a disadvantage, but refuses to betray that to the player. Doing so might encourage the player to attack, putting her cub in danger.The player stumbles upon the nest of an owlbear; a large, predatory hybrid creature. They find themselves in a stand-off against the beast - if they get too close or act aggressively, it attacks. If they keep cool and back off when the opportunity presents itself, the owlbear will let them leave. The player may also notice that the owlbear is wounded - a broken spear protrudes from one eye socket. They may notice that the owlbear has a cub - this is the main reason for her aggression and territoriality.Additional note 1: the player may stumble upon this scenario by themselves, or they may have been pointed in the right direction after meeting some cultists who had a close encounter with the owlbear. If we won these cultists over, they may be available to fight the owlbear at our side.Additional note 2: If the owlbear mother is killed but her cub survives, we can decide the juvenile's fate. If we spare it, we may later find it being used for sport by the goblins in their camp.
session_synopses.PAD_KilledByGoblins: a Voicebark to make it more clear that a band of goblins came and killed the owlbear after the players have seen the owlbear but left the cave with her alive.
session_synopses.VB_EggPickedUp: The player discovers an intact owlbear egg (think something the size of an ostrich egg) and makes an impressed remark. If there's an adult owlbear nearby, the player will remark that interferring with the egg will put them in danger.
session_synopses.VB_EnterCave: The player enters a cave that houses an owlbear - a large, aggressive wild beast. They might comment on the stench of half-eaten prey, or note that some tracks they discovered lead into the cave.
session_synopses.CMB_Enrage: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - in this dialogue specifically, she is enraged.Players encounter an owlbear mother and her cub in a cave. This dialogue plays if players smash her egg or kill her cub in front of her.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Send them to the dirt!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Preparing for battle - and excited for it.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid). Delivery should be vicious and mean-spirited - they're torturing a helpless gnome for sport.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Git over there. Surround 'em, like.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing to the other goblinsNodeContext: In a loud whisper

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I know you're there. Show yourselves.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: You spotted us. Good. 'S like they say...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands on hips, cockyNodeContext: Covering up their surprise

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: No fun in skewerin' a pig what doesn't know he's cooked.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A threat

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: There'll be no skewering happening here. Now let me pass.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: We got you surrounded.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Here's how this goes: you take one step further an' we'll fill your front with arrows.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Or you turn around, an' your backside gets the same treatment.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Out of my way, or I'll cut you down first.
True

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Hold up, lads! This one might be more'n we bargained for.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Throws up a handNodeContext: They're not scared - they're being pragmatic.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Go on, then. Just keep your nose clean.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Waves the players through.

PatrollingGoblin.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin.text: Mind the ogres, your drowsiness. They don't got no respect.

AD_StartedCombat.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_StartedCombat.text: You must got a death wish, sneakin' around in my town.

session_synopses: This dialogue triggers when players enter a village being guarded by goblins. The goblins are on rooftops - the player may either be on the ground or on the rooftops with them (if they've snuck in). If the player has passed a perception check beforehand, the dialogue starts while the goblins are still getting into place for an ambush. Otherwise, the goblins are already in place, surrounding the player.If the player is not a drow, the goblins will attack the player at the end of the dialogue unless players can talk them out of it.
session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin: A goblin is patrolling around the abandoned village on the lookout for intruders. He doesn't want to be bothered.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: Lapis root? Saffa? Rare to see these so far north.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: A shame they've wilted, these must have cost a fortune.

VB_Bookcase.speaker: Player
VB_Bookcase.text: Hmm. Scratch marks on the floor...
VB_Bookcase.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. Noticed a potential clue in an abandoned house.

VB_ReadLedger.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

PAD_EnterSecretLab.speaker: Player
PAD_EnterSecretLab.text: A well-guarded laboratory. What were they hiding down here?

VB_Trap.speaker: Player
VB_Trap.context: NodeContext: A relieved observation. An automated booby trap that had been causing strife just ran out of fuel.

session_synopses.VB_InspectHerbs: The player examines some long-dead herbs in an abandoned house. They may notice the herbs themselves are unusual and exotic - not what you'd typically expect to be cultivated in a small-town apothecary.
session_synopses.VB_Bookcase: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player discovers a clue that leads to the wizard's secret lab.
session_synopses.VB_ReadLedger: The player comments that a ledger they just read suggests the existence of a cellar; one they haven't found yet.
session_synopses.MagicMirror: Player finds a talking mirror that seems to be guarding a door to its old master's secret room. It doesn't recognise you as its master, so it challenges you with three questions to see if you're  friend or foe. If you get the questions wrong, it activates a trap to try and kill you. The mirror hasn't been used in a long time - its master died years ago. The mirror speaks in a cracked, broken voice.
session_synopses.PAD_EnterSecretLab: PAD when you enter the Thayan lab in the cellar (after convincing the magical mirror to open for you). It's obviously long abandoned, but full of twisted glass flasks and other old lab equipment.
session_synopses.VB_Trap: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player reacts to a booby trap they triggered - it just ran out of energy and they survived.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: Wait! Please - don't leave us. What should we do now...?
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Clingy. The cult novice pleads for orders from the player, whom he believes to be a superior.

AD_AtCaveEntrance.speaker: Andrick
AD_AtCaveEntrance.text: Bloody Ed. I wish he'd listened.

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Andrick
Cultist001_InCave.text: How did you get so close to it? What if we're making it angry?

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Andrick
Cultist001_InCave.context: NodeContext: Disbelief. His supposed superior is a malingerer.

Cultist002_Dead.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_Dead.text: Serving... the Absolute... following... Her True Souls...

AD_OwlbearDead.speaker: Brynna
AD_OwlbearDead.text: We did it. For Edowin. And the Absolute.
AD_OwlbearDead.context: NodeContext: Amazed and jubilant. She just witnessed her superior slay a dangerous beast.

session_synopses.Cultists: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.
session_synopses.AD_AtCaveEntrance: Two junior members of a cult have been sent to hunt the wild creature that killed their superior. They've found its nest, but are reluctant to proceed inside and face the beast.
session_synopses.Cultist001_InCave: Novice Andrick, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, has been sent by his supposed superior to attack an owlbear - a wild creature that killed another cultist. He needs to be be emboldened to attack the beast with a small pep talk. If the player does something to arouse suspicion however, Andrick may realise he's been tricked and turn hostile.
session_synopses.Cultist002_Dead: Novice Brynna, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, is dead. Here, the player casts a spell to grant limited and temporary resurrection for the purpose of questioning her. From her, they can learn more about the cult's hierarchy, specfically the meaning of the 'True Soul' rank that is frequently referred to. Her ability to communicate after death is limited - cryptic, broken or repetitive answers to a small range of questions. If she recognises her killer, she can refuse to answer or else lie.
session_synopses.AD_OwlbearDead: Two cult novices express jubilation as their leader successfully kills a dangerous wild beast that killed their brother.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: The House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
Dinner.context: CinematicNodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.NodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...

Dinner.speaker: Player
Dinner.text: I'm getting tired of your games.

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *The tiefling's corpse stirs with the spell.*

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *You realise the tiefling's body has been torn open by huge hands.*

session_synopses.Corpse_Dead: The player can cast Speak with Dead on a tiefling the ogres tore open to feed on.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Huh. Haven't seen that game in years.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Little sing-song to the tune of 'one, two, buckle my shoe'

session_synopses.PAD: A faded children's game marked on the floor - tic-tac-toe or hopscotch, maybe. Different races remark may or may not recall the game from their youth. Planar or gith might not recognize it - assume it's code.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You hear another muffled cry. The two inside are still in the throes of... passion.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Open the door.

node_data.speaker: Grukkoh
node_data.text: Ngh. W-what the hells are you doin'?
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: A look of surprise and facination stretches across the player's face.
Offscreen the couple notices us, the camera catches them scrambling off as quickly as possible.NodeContext: Still busy with his ogress at first, then realises someone entered.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Apologies. I didn't mean to interrupt.

node_data.speaker: Buthir
node_data.text: Ruined! Smash - I'll SMASH YOU!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bugbear is getting off of the ogress and glares at me, if possible, he should be a bit ruffled. The ogress is behind hin and still getting up, adjusting the clothes around her waist. it should be clear they were having sex.NodeContext: The ogress is flying into a rage.

VB_Scholar.speaker: Player
VB_Scholar.text: Yikes, don't disturb a half-ogre in the making!

session_synopses.AD_BugbearKilled: The players have killed the bugbear (the Ogress' lover) and she swears revenge.
session_synopses: The player arrives at a house and hears a strange noise inside. It might sound like a fight is happening inside, but upon closer inspection they can learn that a bugbear and an ogre are making love.
session_synopses.VB_Scholar: Comment made after seeing the ogre and bugbear having sex AND passing a successful Nature check.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: I've got the plans and the sussur bark. Now I need somewhere to craft it all.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: The forge at the blacksmith's house should do.

VB_TakePlans.speaker: Player
VB_TakePlans.text: Weapon blueprints. They call for sussur bark...

VB_TakeJournal.speaker: Player
VB_TakeJournal.text: Interesting. I wonder if those blueprints survived.

VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.speaker: Player
VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.text: What in the hells was that?

VB_FindWeakWall.speaker: Player
VB_FindWeakWall.text: A wonder this shoddy wall hasn't already collapsed.

AD_ForgeWeapon.speaker: Player
AD_ForgeWeapon.text: There's still life left in this old thing.

session_synopses.VB_TakeSussurSap: Voice bark: player takes sussur sap from a tree. SUSS-er. Needed to make a special weapon.
session_synopses.VB_TakePlans: Player reads the blueprints of an incredible weapon.
session_synopses.VB_TakeJournal: The players read a journal from an apprentice smith who wrote about how he'd designed a powerful weapon.
session_synopses.VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear: Player sees a phase spider slip in and out of reality.Probably not clear exactly what it was.
session_synopses.VB_FindWeakWall: Player finds a weak wall. Something's behind it.
session_synopses.AD_ForgeWeapon: The player clicks on a forge. What they say depends on how much of the recipe they have collected. They can make a fancy weapon with the right ingredients.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

PAD_WebWarning.speaker: Player
PAD_WebWarning.text: Better be careful - those webs carry vibrations.

session_synopses.VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance: The player finds the deep pit leading to the underdark.
session_synopses.PAD_WebWarning: PAD when seeing webs. Either just complaining about the fact that the spiderwebs are everywhere, or realising touching them could be dangerous.

AD_WaitingForRelease.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_WaitingForRelease.context: NodeContext: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether.

SlowDown.speaker: Fezzerk
SlowDown.text: What's goin' on back there? Go check it out!
SlowDown.context: NodeContext: He turns to his right as he tells the other goblins to check it out.

session_synopses.AD_WaitingForRelease: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether
session_synopses.SlowDown: The player senses a windmill's rotation slow or halt entirely, or speed up, after the player changed the speed. If present, some goblins go to investigate the disturbance.
session_synopses.AD: If the player gets the windmill to stop spinning, then clicks Barcus, Barcus will get these lines. Barcus will be impatient, mistrustful of the player, but still in need of player's help.
session_synopses.AD_RotatingFasterReaction: Said while being spun faster on the pane of a windmill. Should be in a panic.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Weapon blueprints. A master blacksmith's work.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The inking is rough - a work in progress, surely.

session_synopses.PAD: Players see plans at the workstation where Sampson used to clear his head.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: C'mon, blood-breath. Let's find you something to eat.
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a worg companion, urging it to come along.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Worg
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Worgs are vicious beasts but have a little more sentience than most animals, and are capable of rudimentary speech.

session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin beckons to a worg - time to head off.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Time to leg it out of here.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

AD_Combat_Goblins_Ranger_01.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Combat_Goblins_Ranger_01.text: You'll look good with a few arrows sticking out of your gut!

PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.text: Oi! You fightin' them ogres, then you fightin' with me!

session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight: Goblin near the ogres joins the fight if player gets into combat with them.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Carefully wiggle the dagger until it slides free.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your cautious method pays off. The dagger glides smoothly out of the mystery meat.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: Do you have anything of value?

session_synopses.Dead: We can speak to Gandrel if he dies - he'll hint at his mission to hunt Astarion on behalf of Maiden Fel. Separate options if it's Astarion himself speaking to him.

HusbandGraveForcefield.speaker: Player
HusbandGraveForcefield.context: NodeContext: You just tried to touch a coffin, but it has a forcefield, which hits you with psychic damage.

session_synopses.HusbandGraveForcefield: A forcefield surrounds a coffin. Everytime you touch it, it causes more psychic damage.

PAD_HeroGear.speaker: Player
PAD_HeroGear.text: Sword and a hat. Wonder whose.

PAD_PrickedFinger.speaker: Player
PAD_PrickedFinger.context:
NodeContext: Noise of pain. Your finger has been pricked by a thorn.

Karlach: 'Fing' is on purpose

session_synopses.PAD_HeroGear: A fine sword and feathered hat protrude from the bog. A successful passive Investigation check suggests that long ago a hero came here to slay something, but didn't make it past the first patch of soft ground.
session_synopses.PAD_PrickedFinger: The player has pricked their finger on a thorny bush. The player encounters a thorny bush full of fruit. In order to take the fruit from the bush without cutting theirself, the player must pass a Sleight of Hand test.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: Gods, didn't hear you coming. I know I should head home, but I can't bring myself to leave.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: look up from quietly crying, surprised

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: The thought of putting him in a wheelbarrow and making the journey all over again... *Sigh.*
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: turns back to the grave, arms crossed - then gestures to the coffin. Trying not to cry.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Player
ResurrectHusband.text: I could say a prayer, if you'd like.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: Please. Connor used to say only a fool turned down the divine.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Grateful. Trying not to cry.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Player
ResurrectHusband.text: Quietly whisper a blessing for protection. May Mayrina and her child suffer no harm.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: I miss him. Every moment of every day. Godsdammit.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: Annoyed at yourself as you sturggle to hold back tears. Just about keeping it together

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: Brothers dead, husband turned into summon, Mayrina knows this player killed brothers.NodeContext: Spitting with rage but also on the brink of tears. This player killed people you loved.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: Brothers dead, husband killed by players, Mayrina knows this player killed brothers.NodeContext: Spitting with rage but also on the brink of tears. This player killed people you loved.

SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.text: Quick. Get out of here. She won't like me talking to you.
SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting down in her chair - looking at her foodNodeContext: Afraid - looking around for the hag. Head low.

AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.speaker: Mayrina
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.text: You've a face on you that could turn milk, petal.

AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.speaker: Mayrina
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.text: A walk would cheer me up.
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.context: NodeContext: You ask this tentatively. You're desperate to go outside but don't want to upset Ethel.

AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.text: Hush, now! Won't be discussing that again.
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.context: NodeContext: Smile as you dismiss the girl's request to leave. Cheery.

HusbandResurrected.speaker: Connor Vinderblad
HusbandResurrected.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking around - frantice and afraid. Clumsy and jittering movements.NodeContext: Animalistic noises through you're rotting jaw - looking around for your wife afraid and panicked as you struggled to speak, to form words with a jaw that no longer works

HusbandResurrected.speaker: Connor Vinderblad
HusbandResurrected.context: CinematicNodeContext: Centres on the player and charges - enragedNodeContext: ROARING in rage and fear as you attack the player

AD_HusbandGrave.speaker: Player
AD_HusbandGrave.text: 'Here lies Connor - beloved husband, and a tasty little morsel to boot.'
AD_HusbandGrave.context: NodeContext: Above a gravestone - a cruel jab.

StartScene.text: I don't want a crumb left on that plate, girl.
StartScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Standing, Mayrina sets a plate down on the table, pie still on itNodeContext: Cheerful granny voice - you're merrily ordering Mayrina about

StartScene.speaker: Mayrina
StartScene.text: Auntie Ethel, please. One more bite and this pie is gonna come back up to say hello.
StartScene.context: NodeContext: Trying to stick up for yourself but a touch of fear in your voice. You know she's a hag and you should do as she says but you feel nauseous and sick.

StartScene.text: Don't make me get the wooden spoon. You're eating for two, so get to it!
StartScene.context: InternalNodeContext: Next node - sees player.NodeContext: A cheery rhythm to your voice even at the steel to your tone. You will be obeyed.

StartScene.text: Who is this? A friend of yours?
StartScene.context: NodeContext: Looks up and see the player. Looks from Mayrina to the player - cautious but not worried. You don't know why the player is.

StartScene.speaker: Mayrina
StartScene.text: No! No, I don't know them.
StartScene.context: NodeContext: Panic. You don't want to get in trouble

StartScene.text: Come now - aren't you going to introduce yourself?
StartScene.context: NodeContext: Slight smile as your turn your sights on the player. You're more cheerful now.

StartScene.speaker: Player
StartScene.text: I'd rather know who this woman is first.
Keep your own little nose in your own little dish, petal.
StartScene.context: NodeContext: Said with a forced smile - you don't the player interfering even as you try to maintain a cheerful demeanor
NodeContext: Said with a smile - you don't expect this to come up again

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: I dragged my husband here in a wheelbarrow. Buried him. Took everything the hag threw at  me for him.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: And some godsdamned psychopath digs him up? I hate this place. I hate everyone.

PAD_AfterResurrection.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterResurrection.text: Not quite the outcome intended, but I must say - the technique was excellent.

PAD_AfterResurrection.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterResurrection.text: The spell is cast - what's done is done.

session_synopses.ResurrectHusband: The player has discovered a wand that will allow them to raise Mayrina's husband from the dead. Mayrina is standing by the coffin that holds her dead husband. When player raises Connor from the dead, the coffin door bursts open and he crawls out of it a zombie - unable to speak in anything other than moans and groans. Player can take the zombie as a summon, kill the zombie, or give the zombie to Mayrina.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Dead:
This occurs when Mayrina dies. There are multiple permutationinlcuding, but not limited to, you killed her brothers and/or her husband, she knows that one or more of these people are dead but doesn't blame you, you took her husband as a summon, and you know one of the brothers is dead but she doesn't hold you responsible. 

Sad and far away sound - except in parts when she knows you killed her family.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied: This is an edgecase in which the player talks to Mayrina when the hag isn't present. Mayrina is afraid, looking around for the hag - doesn't want to get into trouble. Sitting down in her chair.
session_synopses.AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene: This fires between Mayrina and the Hag in the teahouse before the player has spoken to either of them.
session_synopses.HusbandResurrected: This is one of the key moments in the hag's region. The player raises Connor from the dead but without Mayrina present cannot control the Zombie that is now Connor. Panicked and afraid, the zombie struggles to call his wife's name before barelling forward - attacking the very person who raised them from the dead,
session_synopses.AD_HusbandGrave: This occurs above the grave of Connor, Mayrina's husband. It was written by the hag and is a cruel jab.
session_synopses.StartScene: This is the main hag dialogue. In it, you can ask about Mayrina (who is present) or make a deal to have your parasite removed. If you keep asking about Mayrina (twice), the hag will be furious and vanish Mayrina away while she deals with the 'busybody' - the player.If you agree to the tadpole deal, you must give up an eye (in the transformed dialogue).
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp: Triggers when Mayrina gets to the grave. In the top node the grave is empty. In the bottom the corpse is lying there for her to see. She leaves and does not return.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterResurrection: The player's found a wand in the Hag's lair and tried to use it to resurrect Mayrina's husband. Unfortunately, it was cursed and he only came back a zombie. The players reflect on using items from evil beings.

AD_HagDisappear.context: NodeContext: You've disappeared into thin air. A mocking goodbye.

AD_Argument.text: You're both this close to getting a slap.
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and unimpressed. You're having none of these brothers  and they're starting to piss you off.

AD_Argument.speaker: Johl
AD_Argument.text: Enough. We know you have her.
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: You're getting tired of Ethel - and trying to sound threatening.

AD_Argument.speaker: Demir
AD_Argument.text: Please, we just want Mayrina back.
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm the situation - you don't want it to get violent and you're also terrified of Ethel/

Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.context: NodeContext: You're brother has just died in front of you.

ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: Player has just saved Ethel. This is exactly what she hoped would happen. Still playing up the old lady act -upset and frazzled and overcome with emotion.

ThankPlayer.text: I - I didn't mean for this to happen.

ThankPlayer.speaker: Player
ThankPlayer.text: The best thanks are paid in gold.
Oh, you're a cheeky pup, aren't you?
ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: Player has asked for gold in return for saving her. You're delighted at how brazen they're being. This is said in a gentle and teasing tone - with a smile.

ThankPlayer.text: But I can respect someone who gets down to business.
ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: This is true - admiration in your voice.

ThankPlayer.text: And such heroic deeds deserve proper thanks.
ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: A sublle hint of amused menace here.

ThankPlayer.text: Why don't you stop by my house? I'll be sure to look after you. See you soon, dearie.
ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: Cheeky wink and a grin.

Confrontation.text: Lads, for the love of all that is holy, I've never clapped eyes on your poor sister.
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at the brothers - hasn't noticed the player yet. NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. Annoyed as you plead with the two men who advance on you. You sound sincere and genuine.

Confrontation.speaker: Johl
Confrontation.text: Drop the act, hag. You was the last to see Mayrina.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Not buying Auntie Ethel's claim that she hasn't seen Mayrina. Accusation and fury in your voice - you're prepared to get violent if needs be.

Confrontation.speaker: Demir
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Your brother is on the brink of violence and you're trying to regain control of the situation. You just want your baby sister back, you don't want anyone to get hurt.

Confrontation.text: You there! Please, I don't know what's come over these boys. I just want to go home.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the player. You call out, fear and pleading in your voice - in your mind you've hatched a plan - you're going to force the player to defend you and kill the brothers.

session_synopses.AD_HagDisappear: AD that fires as the Hag disappears during the ambush.
session_synopses.AD_Argument: This argument is the beginning of the situation. The three of them are yelling at each other out in the open. The brothers believe Ethel has taken their sister, while she is denying any knowledge of the girl.
session_synopses.Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied: Occurs when Demir's brother dies in front of him.
session_synopses.ThankPlayer:
This dialogue occurs if the player has sided with the hag in the ambush and saved her - by killing the brothers.
She's still in old lady mode, hamming up how upset she is, but there should be a hint on the last set of questions, about the gold, that this was an act and that there is more to her than meets the eye.
session_synopses.Confrontation: Auntie Ethel has been cornered by two brothers - Demir and Johl - who claim Ethel is a hag and has taken their sister. Ethel is pleading that she has no idea what they're talking about and begs the player to help her.Ethel is actually a hag. Should we step back and do thing, she summons monsters to cut the two brothers down. Should we side with her, we have to kill the brothers. Should we side with the brothers, Ethel is angry and disappears with a threat.

PAD_TriedTart.speaker: Player
PAD_TriedTart.text: Gods spare me, why did I think eating a second one was a good idea?

AD_TeleportSurrogateMother.text: Come now, Mayrina! Time to go.
AD_TeleportSurrogateMother.context: InternalNodeContext: Leaving with Mayrina, i.e. outside of combat.
InternalNodeContext: Mayrina & hag leave together, Hag is not in combatNodeContext: Mocking tone and wave as you taunt the player.

session_synopses.PAD_TriedTart: Player eats a disguised Hag Tart, not knowing it's truly rotten and noxious. Brave (or foolish) players can eat the tart a second time, deepening their misery.
session_synopses.AD_TeleportSurrogateMother: Fires as the hag grabs Mayrina and teleports to the lair OR Hag is injured and disappears from the fight alone.

Frog.speaker: Player
Frog.text: Hunker down and let the frog come to you.

session_synopses.Frog: This is a small frog in the swamp lands.She has been twisted by Ethel's magic and is desperately trying not to hurt the player - doing everything she can to hold back. If Ethel is dead, the frog is very cheerful and sing song - hopping about. If they player asks for a reward, she cheerfully spits on their shoes and hops off.

PAD_ProtectedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_ProtectedAstarion.text: You protected a child-stealing vampire? Bold choice.

PAD_ProtectedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_ProtectedAstarion.text: Let's hope it doesn't come back to bite me later.

session_synopses.PAD_ProtectedAstarion: This voicebark plays when a player chooses to not give up Astarion to the Gur hunter.Speaker 1 is assumed to be the player who did this action, and speaker 2 may have an opinionated comment on the outcome.Astarion can be neither of the speakers.

session_synopses.WRLD_CleaningTable_Hag: World Behavior for Auntie Ethel wiping down tables while in Hag form
session_synopses.WRLD_TendFlowers_HumanForm: Timeline dialog for Auntie Ethel in human form tending flowers
session_synopses.WRLD_GettingBloodFromTrough: Timeline scene trigger for redcap getting blood from a trough

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: Bloody way to end an argument. I hope we chose the right side.

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: No point in debating what's already done. Let's go on ahead.

session_synopses.PAD_SidedHag: This VB plays after saving Ethel from the two brothers of the sister she's holding captive. Ether disappeared in a magic puff, and she was acting suspicious. The players are reacting to her exit and discussing that there may be more to Ethel than meets the eye.Speaker 1 may have been the character who was in dialog for the scene with Ethel. Speaker 2 is another party member. However, since there may be combat, this setup isn't guaranteed and it's best to write this assuming everyone had a hand in the actions that led to this VB playing.
